Company Description
Publicis Sapient is a digital transformation partner helping established organizations get to their future, digitally-enabled state, both in the way they work and the way they serve their customers. We help unlock value through a start-up mindset and modern methods, fusing strategy, consulting and customer experience with agile engineering and problem-solving creativity. United by our core values and our purpose of helping people thrive in the brave pursuit of next, our 20,000+ people in 53 offices around the world combine experience across technology, data sciences, consulting and customer obsession to accelerate our clients’ businesses through designing the products and services their customers truly value.
Job Description
As a DevOps Architect you will be a part of a smart cross-functional team delivering digital business transformation solutions to our clients. You’ll have the unique opportunity to increase the engineering team productivity by hunting and solving opportunities within the products of some of the world’s largest brands. You’ll be instrumental in helping our engineering teams to deliver customer features faster by identifying opportunities to automate.
Qualifications
Your Skills & Experience:
Hands-on experience with Terraform.
Experience in setting up continuous integration of source code pipelines using Bitbucket, Jenkins, Terraform, and continuous deployment pipelines using Artifactory and Spinnaker.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform.
Experience using Docker.
Strong experience in setting and running Apigee Hybrid infrastructure, on premise installation.
Good understanding of Cassandra and Zookeeper.
Experience with high availability, load balancing and failover configurations with Apigee.
Ability to apply security, throttling, OAuth 2.0, TLS, certificates, KeyStore, and Trust store for the Apigee platform.
Expertise in configuring the Apigee Private Cloud platform, including keystores, truststores, and KVMs.
Experience with Apigee Management APIs and integrations with enterprise systems including Infrastructure & Application monitoring, SAML or LDAP SSO, and Logging.
Have previously worked on an enterprise platform team that supports multiple Software Development product teams.
Capacity Planning and Management activities to ensure that the Apigee platform will be able to scale as per the additional transactions needs in the future.
Hands-on Python and Unix shell scripting is required.
Knowledge of REST API design, API first development, and OpenAPI specifications.
Good to have certification in Apigee.
Deployment of the Apigee Management plane in GCP
End to end Delivery of Implementation and deployment of Apigee Management plane in GCP
Perform hands-on deployment of solutions into Customer’s GCP production environment
Develop automation code for Apigee Hybrid environment
Provide SME to support Production cloud environments and/or tooling including Openshift, GCP & EKS
Additional Information
Benefits of Working Here:
Eligible for 3 weeks PTO
14 paid holidays throughout the year
Generous parental leave and new parent transition program
Tuition reimbursement
Corporate gift matching program
As part of our dedication to an inclusive and diverse workforce, Publicis Sapient is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at hiring@publicissapient.com or you may call us at +1-617-621-0200.

Our client is a world wide, Fortune 500 telecom vendor working across technologies such as 5G, Cloud, Networking and much more. with Canada's top Telecom firms. They are currently seeking to add a Solutions Architect - Security & Cloud to their team for a long term, potentially multi-year contract.

Lead the team on NFR (Non Functional Requirements) situations and make best cloud practice recommendations to achieve top NFRs
Lead the team on Information Security awareness/ compliance (e.g. iso 27001)
lead the team on authentication/authorization protocols and models such as (RBAC/ABAC/OIDC/OAUTH/SAML/SSO)
Experienced with Cloud application solutioning (IBM private, AWS, Azure etc)
Architect DevOps factories
Lead the team to and explain the rationale behind choosing databases, api services, containerization and other. The goal is to have an architect explain why you would implement xyz tool from a business requirement point of view.
Guide team and explain the benefits of cloud native architecture (microservices) vs monoliths, Pro’s & con’s, why people move to cloud native, benefits.
Understanding of the benefits of public/private/hybrid cloud and how to leverage cloud native design in these types of architectures.
Stakeholder management: need to interface Product Owners, developers and different stakeholders and align architectural vision and business requirements
Drive and document studies
Create network diagrams, Technical Product Documentation, HLD

Good communication skills (in English)
Have a good background with Networking/firewall
Understanding of SDLC
Leadership – self driven and able to tie people together
Good negotiation skills
Good problem solving skills
Able to make fact based decisions

About Open Systems
Open Systems delivers cybersecurity beyond expectations. We partner with organizations to boost the security performance of their digital transformations. Our award-winning Managed Detection and Response (MDR) and Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) services connect and protect customers today, while increasing their security maturity for tomorrow.

Open Systems’ Mission Control SOCs and NOCs are staffed by certified, outcome-obsessed engineers who provide 24x7 global coverage. They leverage a platform backed by data science and years of finetuning complex processes to better understand and reduce attack surfaces. Our deep expertise as a 5-time Microsoft Gold Partner accelerates and simplifies the path to security maturity by unlocking the value of existing investments in Microsoft security tools.

Deployed in nearly 10,000 locations across 184 countries, Open Systems has earned an out of this world 97% retention rate. No wonder our customers call it crazy good cybersecurity.

Discover more at www.open-systems.com.

Currently, we are looking for an

Azure Cloud Architect

Your Mission

Join our enthusiastic feature team of engineers and face the challenge to bring the threat detection and response platform of Open Systems to the next level. As an Azure Architect in the Managed Detection and Response team, you will use your knowledge and experience to architect and build modern
solutions on the Azure platform. You will be part of a crazy good cybersecurity solution.

As an Azure Cloud Architect for Open Systems, you will be responsible for:

Architecting Microsoft Azure Solutions across multiple platforms
Building governance and security around the Azure platform and how it fits into the solutions.
Designing Identity and Access management with Azure AD and Azure resources
Providing Microsoft Azure architecture collaboration with other technical
Designing and building observability platform using modern monitoring and management tools
Documentation of solutions (e.g. architecture, configuration and setup).
Working within a project management/agile delivery methodology in a leading role as part of a wider team.
Provide effective knowledge transfer and up skilling to relevant customer personnel to ensure an appropriate level of future self-sufficiency.
Implementation and Delivery of Microsoft Azure projects

Your Qualifications
Direct experience with range services from the Microsoft Azure Cloud Platform including Infrastructure and Security related services such as Azure AD, IaaS, Containers, Storage, Networking and Azure Security.
Direct experience of enterprise solution shaping and Microsoft Azure Cloud architecture development including excellent documentation skills.
Familiarity with Azure Architecture and design patterns.
Experience with designing event driven and microservices architecture using Azure native solutions.
Deep technical experience in cloud application solutions and building resilient, scalable multi-site/region architectures.
Experience with developing and consuming scalable APIs.
Demonstrated ability to write detailed (functional spec level) architectural designs.
Advise teams on appropriate Azure services selection.
Experience with setting up, deploying and managing multiple environments to support agile development approaches.
Experience around building the monitoring, alerting and notification solutions for Azure platform with tools like Azure Log Analytics and Sentinel.
Experience with establishing proactive monitoring and alerting capabilities for all components of the platform.
Deep understanding of coding best practices and modern architectural patterns, including micro services and message-driven architectures
Recent hands-on experience with DevOps toolset like GitHub Enterprise.
Experienced in the design and delivery of enterprise level Highly Available solutions.
Establishing system health and capacity so it can be reviewed and enhanced as needed.
Possesses familiarity with configuration management across a multi-platform estate such as Ansible, Puppet, Terraform, or ARM Templates.
Flexibility and willingness to carry out different roles, can work independently, self-motivated and problem solver.
Flexibility on working with teams with different time zones outside US.

Bonus Skills
Azure Solution Architects certification e.g. AZ – 303, AZ – 304 preferred
Knowledge of Security Operations, architecting and building security solutions like EDR, MDR, XDR a plus
Familiarity with high availability orchestration engines like Temporal and rapid development tools such as streampipe is an added plus
Problem-solving mentality leveraging internal and/or external resources
Familiarity with the agile secure lifecycle and threat modeling
Experience with AWS and GCP
Experience with development languages like Go, Python, .Net core etc

This is a remote position and can be located anywhere in Canada.

What We Offer

Want to join a crazy good cybersecurity team? You’ll be among people who believe in:

Caring PASSIONATELY about keeping our customers safe – We’re dedicated to solving problems. Whatever it takes.

Thinking UNCONVENTIONALLY to stay ahead – The world never fails to surprise us. So let’s surprise it first.

Doing the hard work to make things SIMPLE – Craft and hone something that delights in its simplicity.

Working COLLABORATIVELY to build success – The power of the team will always make us faster and better.

As a testament to this, Open Systems has been recognized as an outstanding place to work. You’ll be surrounded by smart teams who enrich your experience and provide opportunities you will need to develop your skills and advance your career.

Come as you are! We search for amazing people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. Open Systems welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status. Only direct applications will be considered!

#LI-BV1

Introduction

At IBM, we know that transformation drives change, and it is in our DNA to continuously transform. Our IBM Expert Labs organization helps drive large scale change that spans IBM business units and geographies. As a part of this team, you will have the unique opportunity to be a part of driving IBM’s ongoing transformation as a company that continuously innovates and leads the market.
At IBM Expert Labs, we help our clients plan, prove, adopt, and scale IBM technologies to achieve business results.

Your Role and Responsibilities

Do you have a passion for solving complex business problems with the latest Solution Architect methodologies, tools, and techniques? Are you passionate about working with architecture of innovative technology solutions and leading other talented professionals while honing your expertise? IBM Expert Labs is looking for talented individuals to accelerate the adoption of the IBM Data & AI and Automation Solutions by specializing in the architecture and capabilities of Intelligent asset management, monitoring, predictive maintenance and reliability on IBM Cloud, Amazon, Azure, or Google public clouds. The IBM Expert Labs Solution Architect is a person who can design, plan and architect an IBM Data & AI and / or Automation solution.
As an IBM Expert Labs Solution Architect, you will recommend and leverage needed technologies, architectures, integrated solutions, and tooling to enable the sales and services delivery teams across the organization.
Who you are:
You have the ability to communicate complex situations clearly and simply by listening actively and conveying difficult messages in a positive manner.
You understand the value of innovation and are quick to develop new ideas and initiatives that improve the performance of the organization.
You demonstrate leadership experience and are adaptable, willing to readily take ownership of tasks and problems which often extend beyond initial scope of responsibility.
You have the ability to evaluate customers current state and architect an IBM Data & AI and / or Automation solution, taking into account current (and future) business problems
You are experienced interfacing directly with customers in face to face and/or remote engagements
You are able to migrate solutions from competitor cloud platforms using IBM & third-party products and tooling.
You provide leadership to successfully migrate customers using both “lift and shift” models as well as application transformation to microservices.
You provide infrastructure recommendations based on current industry best practices, and propose deployment options


Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Basic understanding of Hybrid Cloud Strategies (IBM Cloud, AWS, Azure, etc.).
Basic understanding of Networks and DevOps
Basic understanding of Artificial Intelligence (AI)
Interest in RedHat OpenShift and containerization
Strong communication skills, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs.
Can work on multiple tasks concurrently and meet deadlines, while maintaining focus in an environment with conflicting demands.
Demonstrate strong interpersonal skills with ability to collaborate and work effectively in an intense team environment, able to build direct working relationships across all levels of IBM and the client teams.


Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
1-3 years of experience in an Architect role
Experience creating highly available applications solutions across multiple platforms containers (RedHat OpenShift/Kubernetes and supporting products).
Demonstrate knowledge of IBM Data & AI and / or Automation concepts and architectural principles
Demonstrate knowledge of authentication options
Demonstrate knowledge of IBM Data & AI and / or Automation product configuration capabilities, including applications, workflows, database and automation scripting

Key Job Details Country/Region:CA State:ONTARIO City:Markham Category:Architect Required Education:Bachelor's Degree Position Type:Entry Level Employment Type:Full-Time Contract Type:Regular Company:(0026) IBM Canada Limited – IBM Canada Limitee Req ID:597779BR Travel Required:Up to 40% or 2 days a week (home on weekends- based on project requirements)

The AWS Cloud Architect develops innovative solutions and technology strategy around Cloud landscape.
They own the E2E solution design across technologies in an Hybrid environment : on-Prem/AWS
Responsibilities:
Owns solution design for cross domain initiatives and works across domains to ensure cohesive solution.
Reviews and identifies the gaps in the architecture and solution designs, assesses and defines remediation efforts or mitigation options.
Drives to practical solutions considering all teams, initiatives and long-term outlook.
Drives the overall technical design and end-to-end solution design for assigned initiatives.
Ensures quality, consistency and alignment of designs to organization’s standards and digital strategy.
Drives large cross domain initiatives that are supported by E2E Design, applies digital standards to project Solution Architecture, drives Technical Strategy and architectural tradeoff discussions
Minimum Education Qualification:
Master's Degree in Software Engineering and/or Bachelors Degree in Computer Systems Engineering
AWS Certification: Solution Architect Professional (preferred), Solution Architect Associated
Work Experience Qualification:
Design of AWS architecture for cloud native applications (PAAS)
Design of AWS architecture at scale (size like Sanofi)
Define architecture blueprints and standards
Collaborate with applications team to transform their application to AWS
Very good understanding of AWS Landing Zone with more than 200 AWS accounts
Good knowledge of on-prem architectures
IOT experience is a plus
As a healthcare company and a vaccine manufacturer, Sanofi has an important responsibility to protect individual and public health. All US based roles require individuals to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as part of your job responsibilities.
Fully vaccinated, according to the CDC, an individual is considered to be “fully vaccinated” fourteen (14) days after receiving (a) the second dose of the Moderna or Pfizer vaccine, or (b) the single dose of the J&J vaccine. Fully vaccinated, for new Sanofi employees, is to be fully vaccinated 14 DAYS PRIOR TO START DATE.
Sanofi Inc. and its U.S. affiliates are Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employers committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race; color; creed; religion; national origin; age; ancestry; nationality; marital, domestic partnership or civil union status; sex, gender, gender identity or expression; affectional or sexual orientation; disability; veteran or military status or liability for military status; domestic violence victim status; atypical cellular or blood trait; genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing) or any other characteristic protected by law.

At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.

Introduction
At IBM, our Project Managers excel by leading and coordinating a project team’s overall performance, scope, cost, and deliverables. Our clients rely on timely and efficient status reports, and as a Project Manager Assistant, you will drive the charge with project direction, metric definition, and performance management.

The IBM Expert Labs practice contains Architects, Product Specialists and Project Managers with deep product skills that can help accelerate a client journey to maximize the value of a software implementation. The engagement sizes range from strategy and quick start deployments to First of a Kind (FOAK) implementations.

If you are ready to help our clients and project teams succeed, we would love to meet you!

Your Role and Responsibilities
The primary responsibility of the Project Manager Assistant (PMA) is to provide administration for IBM’s contractual responsibilities. This includes working with IBMers as well as third-party vendors. In this role, PMA will be responsible to provide project management support to review the Statement of Work (SOW) and the contractual responsibilities of both parties with the client.

The PMA works tasks independently but keeps the Project Manager and leadership promptly apprised of work status, raising issues of risk to the appropriate level with oversight from a Project Manager. In small projects, the PMA is responsible for the overall project plan, budget, structure, and schedule for the delivery organization.

Primary Job responsibilities
Work with Project Managers to provide a framework to Cloud and Cognitive Software (C&CS) Expert Labs project teams
Coordinate and manage the activities of project personnel
Create Project Management deliverables
Maintain project communications with the client
Create regular status reports
Conduct regular status meetings with clients and project stakeholders
Provide monthly financial forecasts to Project Managers
Keep management cadence with the Project Manager and Delivery Leaders to provide insight on project status
Develop knowledge of C&CS Expert Labs offerings with awareness on emerging technologies and solutions
Administer the contract change control procedure with the client
Review the SOW and the contractual responsibilities of both parties with your Project Manager
Ensure Project Health is updated and maintained internally
Provide Forecasting on projects you own
Ensure Project Burn Rate is maintained and accurate
Report utilization of project billing
Perform Invoice reconciliation
Perform monthly financial forecasting
Perform resource onboarding and tracking
Manage the Project Control Book and Project Repository
Administer the Project Change Control Procedure for SOW changes

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Ability to participate in a virtual office setting and maintain an active and dynamic presence via phone and email
Have initiative to actively seek new knowledge and improve skills
Knowledge of effective self-management practices; ability to manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, groups, or activities, making effective judgements as to prioritizing and time allocation
Knowledge of approaches, tools, techniques for recognizing, anticipating, and resolving organizational, operational or process problems; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations
Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors
Understanding of customer service, relationship management, and facilitation skills
Solid personal leadership and management skills with a collaborative style
Demonstrate leadership experience and ability to adapt, with willingness to readily take ownership of tasks and problems, which often extend beyond initial scope of responsibility

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Familiarity and experience with software development processes
Familiarity and experience with project management processes and techniques
Experience with Microsoft Office Tools including MS Project, MS Word, MS PowerPoint and MS Excel
Project Management Certification (e.g. PMP) is an asset
Internship or work experience in corporate setting with demonstrated track record

About Business Unit
IBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities. Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone. It's time to define your career.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement
Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.

This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Syria, and the Crimea, Luhansk and Donetsk regions of Ukraine) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Requisition ID: 159791
Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

ROLE PURPOSE:
Tangerine has embarked on the journey to modernize development practices, tools, and runtime environments. One of the main areas of transformation is the adoption of public Cloud and the various platform technologies that support both development and operations on the cloud.
The Cloud Architect will be part of the Cloud Platform/Enterprise Architecture team, responsible for the Cloud adoption strategy and for creating platform components and services for the broad enterprise use (infrastructure and application teams).

ROLE ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Establish mid and long-term vision, strategy, and roadmaps for the Cloud platform capabilities required by Tangerine.
Define Reference Architecture
Clearly communicate the vision and technology roadmap to various team and stakeholders.
Develop, document, and maintain cloud platforms, services and components to enable safe enterprise-wide use of cloud common functionality.
Work with Cloud providers to identify new technologies, and to support the evolution and availability of the services enabled in the platform.
Develop software/pipelines for enabling and automating provisioning and maintenance of cloud platform and related components.
Design and implement Infrastructure as Code.
Work with other engineers and architects on breaking-down, scoping, and estimating tasks.
Participate in planning, retrospective sessions, attending stand-ups, etc.
Design and build highly available and scalable infrastructure, as example, Kubernetes.
Support application and infrastructure teams on the use of cloud platform including providing guidance on available options, design patterns, best practices, and security considerations.
Enable controls and practices to enforce that applications will meet non-functional requirements, as high availability, integrity, reliability, disaster recovery and optimal cost.
Define and facilitate architectural and other governance process activities in line with Application Development Lifecycle and Quality Assurance steps.
Mentor and coach others within assigned area.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor (equivalent or higher) degree in computer science or engineering/mathematics discipline.
Enthusiasm for cloud transformation and cloud platform/components/services development.
Strong development experience and breadth of language and framework experience.
Strong understanding of software development life cycle as well as related technologies.
Understanding of software release process (environments, binary repositories, CI/CD) is required.
Strong understanding of cloud infrastructure and/or networking is required.
Experience developing and deploying cloud infrastructure is required.
In-depth knowledge of software architecture, design patterns, and security considerations.
Expertise in cloud platform features and capabilities is required.
Proven experience in Google GCP is strong benefit.
Writing and maintaining related documentation
Competent in:
o Kubernetes (Ideally GKE)
o Java / Spring Framework
o Security technologies and concepts
o High availability systems design
o Performance Tuning
o Web APIs
o Microservices architecture
o DevOps concepts
o Terraform or similar IaC technologies
o Open source technologies
o Linux
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : North York
At Tangerine we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the team, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.

Jolera Inc. is a multinational technology hybrid aggregate service provider (HASP) focused on delivering IT solutions As-a-Service for its customers and channel partners. We are Canadian-based with more than 18 years of experience in the industry.
We know that IT solutions require more than just technology – they need skilled people behind them. That is why we assembled a great team of experts who are committed to finding the best solutions for your needs. Our people are focused, client-driven, and passionate about connecting users with technology.
About the role
The primary role of the Microsoft Cloud Engineer/Architect – Azure & O365 will be to grow our mid-market technology services practice.
The Cloud Engineer/Architect – Azure & O365 is primarily responsible for the implementation of public, private, and hybrid cloud technologies. Typical responsibilities for this position include the design and implementation of Office 365, Exchange Online, and Azure.
Responsibilities:
Assess, architect, design, implement and troubleshoot complex enterprise solutions around Microsoft public, private, and hybrid clouds.
Serve as the expert in Azure Infrastructure as a service (IaaS), Azure Platform as a service (PaaS), Azure Analysis Services, Azure Site Recovery, Office 365, Azure AD, and High availability
Recommend, implement and maintain secure environments running in Azure using industry-accepted standards (MFA, Azure Firewall, Intune, etc.)
Provide support, migrations, optimizations, and deployments for a wide range of Microsoft Azure/Office365, SQL, Microsoft 365 technologies, Azure Virtual Machines (VM), RDS server setup, management, and maintenance.
Act as a subject matter expert/Tier III support for the operations team as it pertains to the Microsoft landscape.
Assist in the development and perform the deployment of policies and other best practice configurations using Microsoft Office 365 Security Center and related components.
Troubleshoot moderate to complex issues across the breadth of the O365 solution.
Design, Plan and Execute Office 365 migrations including Exchange Online, OneDrive, SharePoint Online, and Skype/MS Teams
Design and plan for Identity Management (ADFS, Azure, Other) and Directory Sync supporting O365 workloads
Stay current on Office 365 features and capabilities including availability, reliability, performance, monitoring, backup, and security
Requirements:
5+ years experience in infrastructure support, design, and or implementation of Microsoft or similar technologies.
3+ years of professional experience planning, architecting, configuring, and deploying to Azure.
In-depth knowledge of Microsoft core platform technologies based on Windows Server.
Experience and working knowledge with Microsoft Azure Infrastructure as a Service platform, including planning, configuration, optimization, and deployment.
Working knowledge of supporting IT infrastructure technologies such as networking, storage, and security.
Expert in DNS, Active Directory, Intune, Azure Active Directory, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Teams infrastructures and how they integrate with the larger Microsoft collaboration platform.
Expert in managing Microsoft Active Directory / AD Federated Services, Azure AD.
Expert in defining and implementing security best practices for Azure, MDM, and Office 365 (Multi-Factor Authentication, DKIM, Advanced Threat Protection)
Significant hands-on experience in administering large O365 (Office, Exchange, SharePoint, MS Teams, Azure AD, Intune), Exchange hybrid environments
Strong Knowledge of Office 365 support technologies including but not limited to, Active Directory, DirSync, Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS), Azure Active Directory, Conditional Access Policies
Implementation-level knowledge of Microsoft Infrastructure including Active Directory, Azure AD, Azure SSO, and MFA
Remain current on Microsoft solutions including Active Directory, Office 365, Azure, SCCM, and Windows servers.
Expert knowledge of Powershell.
Detail-Oriented and Organized
Ability to prioritize multiple activities and tasks
Job Type: Full-time

Job Description :
Architect Cloud native/Hybrid cloud infrastructure solutions for CAC
Architect CI/CD solutions for various use cases and technologies
Help recruit/mentor DevOps and Cloud Engineers for CAC
Engage with Production Engineering in the design and implementation of the AWS infrastructure
Develop cloud security strategy and drive the adoption of new technologies for CAC
Engage with Architect teams to align on AWS Well-Architected framework during the design phase to deliver high-performing, resilient, and efficient infrastructure for various applications and workloads
Contribute towards operational budgets and estimates for new/existing solutions
Produce, update and endorse architectural design patterns, documentation, standards, guidelines and procedures
Qualifications:
12+ years of total experience
At least 5-7 years’ experience as a Cloud Architect
Strong experience with PowerShell, Bash, Python, Perl scripting language to automate operational tasks
Strong experience with .NET/.NET Core software build and release tools using Docker, GitHub Actions and Octopus Deploy
Experience with Linux Server administration
Experience with IaC using AWS Cloud formation or Terraform, AWS CDK

You will be part of a talented team of engineers, who are mainly focused on Infrastructure. This job consists of both Azure Infrastructure and Cloud Network management.

Hands-on experience to install, configure, test, and deploy enterprise and multi-cloud network infrastructure.

Basic experience in network management including supporting and maintaining campus and DC equipment such as edge NGFW, Routers, WAN, LAN, VPN, Voice and Wi-Fi, core switches, SAN switches and top-of-rack switches.
Strong problem-solving skills is required in this role.
Due to the nature of the role; strong collaboration skills, communication, detail orientation are all critical for success in the role.

Experience working within a structured process methodology (i.e. ITIL).
Strong systems aptitude demonstrated project management and planning skills; balanced strategic skills with tactical execution skills.
Highly motivated, self-starter who is eager to grow within our organization.

Work with internal architecture, infrastructure, governance, and security teams to ensure that all security, governance and business continuity requirements and best practices are integrated and implemented.

Research and maintain up-to-date knowledge of current technology trends and best practices. Regularly evaluate cloud applications, designs, and best practices.

Work closely with internal business partners to gather requirements, design and implement solutions, manage technical operations, and triage and resolve operational issues.

Respond to technical issues in a professional and timely manner.
Manage and coordinate support incidents with external vendors.

Manager’s Message:
Aptum is currently in the process of delivering a Hybrid Cloud Platform which incorporates a Hybrid Cloud Management portal. This offers our customers a unique way to manage their multi-cloud estate in an efficient manner. As our Cloud Product Architect, your primary focus will be on the delivery of this platform, and you will work collaboratively with colleagues to build on the work already done with regard to the research, design, commercials, implementation, documentation and training of the product.
How do you become an integral part of the team?
Involvement in other key products on the company’s product roadmap.
Be passionate about the cloud and have a positive, “can do” attitude. You will be keen to learn and keep your knowledge up to date.
Use your knowledge and attitude to help the company to deliver products that are exciting, innovative and add real value for our customers.
There will be opportunities to be involved in all aspects of product research, design, development and release, but your primary focus throughout will be the architectural design of the products.
Elements of market research and review, product component research, evaluation and recommendation as well as risk review and security review.
You will be expected to be involved in product structuring, documentation and deployment. You will have to establish lines of responsibility for the ongoing sustainment of the products as well as their deployment and will be actively involved in training requirements for the teams responsible.
Following successful system launch, you will be accountable for ensuring that cloud products remain relevant and up to date in the marketplace. You will be the subject matter expert for the technologies being deployed and be able to assist with internal questions that may arise.

What we will count on you for:
Cloud evangelist
Great cloud and technical knowledge
Logical thinking
Methodical
Enthusiasm
Reliability
Keen to learn
Ambition
Friendly
Good communicator & listener
What you will bring to the team:
Experience of cloud systems architecture
Ability to think holistically about the impact of new products, not just on our customers but also the impact they will have on our sustainment teams
Ability to build relationships; being able to show compassion, sensitivity and have a sense of humor.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work flexible or non-standard work hours when necessary and perform on-call duties for after-hours support when called upon to do so.
Critical thinking. Be able to break down large environments and issues into the most important items and collaborate on a plan to resolve issues.
Self-motivated, highly enthusiastic and influential amongst peers
Must be a strong team player and comfortable in communicating with new people in other areas of the business with the aim of delivering the team’s objectives.
Keen and enthusiastic to learn

What you bring to Aptum
Degree in IT related discipline or equivalent experience.
Architect certification in cloud technologies or equivalent experience.
Minimum 5 years implementing, administering, or supporting virtualization and cloud technologies.
Solid understanding of virtualisation and hybrid, multi-cloud environments
Business Analysis experience or certification is a plus.
You’ll make the A list if
You can provide details of your previous Cloud implementation(s) in Azure, AWS, VMware-based environments.
You have a “can do” attitude and love to work in a busy environment.
You’re all action – You just want to get stuff done; and when you do it, you do it right.
When the odds are stacked against delivering, you still manage to deliver.

What Aptum has to offer you
Competitive Vacation Policy
Birthdays are off (we call it “Duvet Days”)
Health Club Discounts & Quarterly Reimbursements
Education Reimbursements
Paid Benefits
Community Days

We are seeking an enthusiastic and passionate professional for a Cloud Solution Architect position with extensive experience with AWS cloud services. This role will support BMO Capital Markets cloud roadmap, facilitating innovation and adoption of next-generation technologies. The role will collaborate with Capital Markets development teams, Engineering, Enterprise Architecture and other stakeholders, connecting subject matter experts with business, information, domain and solution architects.
Your skills are broad – designing, documenting and implementing cloud and application patterns, participate in the review of patterns with other stakeholders, working with cloud engineering team members and stakeholders to codify best-practices and advising business technology teams on the use of cloud patterns to develop application solution designs. You will lead architecture, design, and development of end to end Cloud-based solutions with a heavy focus on application and data and a good understanding of infrastructure.
You are a self-starter, driven and can handle multiple projects and priorities. You are passionate about driving the DevOps mindset and culture in a fast-paced, challenging environment where you get the opportunity to work with a spectrum of latest tools and technologies to drive forward “Infrastructure-as-Code” and “Infrastructure-as-a-Service”.
Your Responsibilities:
Architect and implement cloud solutions for various Capital Markets application architectures, and programmatic integration of cloud applications, data services, and infrastructure.
Develop application data architecture models to further enable effective service-oriented delivery
Review application solution designs for cloud-fit and optimality and automate deployment patterns for reusability.
Drive holistic design & patterns for secure, performant and agile cloud application environments relevant to Capital Markets use cases
Collaborate with other architects, operational/infrastructure and delivery teams to ensure new services align with application & infrastructure roadmaps
Consult and provide technical guidance to Capital Markets technology teams to refactor their application for the cloud using the 12-factor development practices for cloud-native and microservices oriented application deployment.
Partner with other stakeholders to drive the creation of Cloud migration & transformation strategy and infrastructure roadmaps across application, information, business and technology landscapes
Establish pilots and POCs for new cloud innovations
Satisfy BMO's architecture practices and process requirements
Required Core Skills:
Deep understanding of cloud design patterns, cloud native architecture and principles, cloud operations and cloud security models, relevant to high volume, high velocity, mission critical trading systems
Demonstrated hands-on experiencing in designing and configuring secure and scalable cloud platforms patterns on AWS
In-Depth knowledge of cloud services: Application integration, functions, Cloud Databases, data warehouse and analytics, Machine Learning, Developer Tools, Security and identity management
Proven and demonstrable experience in architecting, designing and implementing high volume, high availability cloud applications with a very high degree of automation
Demonstrated ability to easily deal with both abstract and concrete concepts and be able to reconcile them for the appropriate audience and context
Proven ability to maintain both a strategic long-term outlook and enterprise perspective, while also supporting tangible, business-driven and IT-delivered solutions.
Quickly understand organizational dynamics and management priorities, and to be able to work effectively in a fast-paced, results-driven company.
Demonstrate strong facilitation, negotiation, interpersonal, communication and collaboration skills.
Strong interpersonal, communication and leadership skills, capable of leading less experienced architects
Self-motivated with a positive attitude and an ability to work independently and or in a team
Ability to communicate across business units and the ability to interface with and communicate complex technical concepts to a broad range of internal and external stakeholders
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.
Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

6+ years of experience architecting, building, or operating cloud-based applications or infrastructures
Technical degree required; Computer Science or Math background desired
2+ years relevant experience in technology/software sales or pre-sales consulting
Job summary
Do you like startups? Are you interested in cloud computing? Yes? We have a role you might find interesting.

Startups are the large enterprises of the future. These young companies are founded by ambitious people who have a desire to build something meaningful and to challenge the status quo. To address underserved customers, or to challenge incumbents. They usually operate in an environment of scarcity: whether that’s capital, engineering resource, or experience. This is where you come in.

The AWS Startup Solutions Architecture team is dedicated to working with these early stage startup companies as they build their businesses. We’re here to make sure that they can deploy the best, most scalable, and most secure architectures possible – and that they spend as little time and money as possible doing so.

We are looking for technical builders who love the idea of working with early stage startups to help them as they grow. In this role, you’ll work directly with a variety of interesting customers and help them make the best (and sometimes the most pragmatic) technical decisions along the way. You’ll have a chance to build enduring relationships with these companies and establish yourself as a trusted advisor.

As well as spending time working directly with customers, you’ll also get plenty of time to “sharpen the saw” and keep your skills fresh. We have more than 175 services across a range of different categories and it’s important that we can help startups take advantages of the right ones. You’ll also play an important role as an advocate with our product teams to make sure we are building the right products for the startups you work with. And for the customers you don’t get to work with on a 1:1 basis you’ll get the chance to share your knowledge more broadly by working on technical content and presenting at events.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
Experience in the startup community as either a founder, mentor, investor, or early technical employee
Experience architecting/operating solutions build on AWS
Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and developers
Excellent communication skills with an ability to right level conversations
Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

Who are we?
Amdocs helps those who build the future to make it amazing. With our market-leading portfolio of software products and services, we unlock our customers’ innovative potential, empowering them to provide next-generation communication and media experiences for both the individual end user and enterprise customers. Our 30,000 employees around the globe are here to accelerate service providers’ migration to the cloud, enable them to differentiate in the 5G era, and digitalize and automate their operations. Listed on the NASDAQ Global Select Market, Amdocs had revenue of $4.3 billion in fiscal 2021. For more information, visit Amdocs at www.amdocs.com
In one sentence
Solution Architects are the chief technical SMEs that lead and manage the process of building a proposed BSS/OSS solutions that fits customers’ needs based on Amdocs products, services, and partners by grouping together knowledge and individual product experts to achieve that goal.
We are looking for a Solution Architects who is passionate about solving complex problems and is eager to take on new problems and share solutions in the most create ways possible as we push forward with our innovative offerings and partner eco-system.
What will your job look like?
You will formulate solutions based on client technical and business requirements, and orchestrate the variety of Amdocs products and/ or services and /or partners that are involved in the proposed solution
You will develop and deliver customer focused presentations of proposed solutions, including advanced product concepts, future directions and complementary products/solutions, to C-Level as well as to technical levels in the customer’s organization
You will design solutions and formulate response to RFx, create POC/demos, and presents solutions to customers. Utilize deep technical knowledge of products and services to align appropriate solutions based on client need.
You will ensure that any proposed solution reflects the Amdocs value proposition and our competitive advantages. As well as recommend how Amdocs offering will function and will be integrated into the client environment, and how open and easy it will be to maintain post-production
You will share and communicate end-to-end solutions to executives, business sponsors, IT, and stockholders
You will keep learning and educating yourself with industry trends, standards, and awareness of competition in order to identify business opportunities
Using your close relationship with the customer, you will be responsible for harvesting enhancements and expansion of existing deployments
You will function as a technical authority, and advise presales and sales teams during the sales process
You will provide feedback to product management, drive product roadmap and ensure the optimum features are made available in order to reduce the cost of deployment and improve the quality of our solutions
All you need is...
7+ years’ experience in the communications/ telecom industry.
5+ years in solutions architecture or sales engineering experience.
Proven working experience in delivering OSS & BSS Solutions
Excellent oral and written communication skills for effective dialogue with colleagues on a project team and with customers (business executive and technical.
An ability to influence key stakeholders and get buy in on technical decisions
A burning desire to ‘be your best’ and make an impact
Ability to work in an ambiguous environment
Collaborate effectively in a team and open to exploring all technical design options;
Ability to build and foster the technical relationship with the customers at all levels including C-Level representatives.
Why you will love this job:
This is a unique opportunity for you to take a leading role in positioning Amdocs solutions and be involved in new and exciting domains
You will have the opportunity to work with leading industry customers
You will function as the technical guru and will have the opportunity to influence on the solutions we provide to our top customers
You will have the opportunity to work in a growing organization, with a high driven sales team
Amdocs is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce

What we’re about
IMAX is not your everyday entertainment experience, so it’s not surprising that IMAX employees and their careers go beyond the ordinary. Our employees share a passion for quality in everything they do. Our Hollywood people are movie business insiders with years of production experience. Our technology experts are unashamedly geeky – people who can talk for hours, and be riveting, about color gamut and lasers. Our business people are consummate sales and marketing professionals who are spreading the IMAX word around the world.
Of course, we offer all the benefits you’d expect from a company with over 50 years of history. Yet, beyond this, we know everyone works differently and is motivated by different things. That’s why we offer competitive pay and a wide assortment of benefits – to help you make the most of your life at work and away from it.
As the world’s leading entertainment technology company, IMAX has revolutionized the way people experience movies. Specializing in immersive motion picture technologies, our employees are driven by a passion to take audiences around the world to places they’ve only dreamed of.
Come explore IMAX – where innovation, creativity and passion come together.
Who we need
We are looking for a Cloud Architect to join our expert team of energetic and knowledgeable staff building the next generation of advanced technology stacks. You will collaborate with your peers in the Technical Operations group and multiple Engineering groups to design, implement, roll-out, secure and maintain the infrastructure for several internet-facing and private environments. You will play a critical role on projects, bringing stability, elasticity and security to our infrastructure as we transition and manage our existing Cloud presence.
What's in it for you
Inspiration. This is a top-class Theater system with complex camera technologies and extremely high quality and availability standards for the 1600 theatres set up for IMAX. You are passionate about the art and science of film and want a role at an organization that inspires. You want to take on the challenges of an ever-changing environment at an organization that is evolving to go beyond the film and into other entertainment formats.
Ignition. We foster a continuous learning environment, sharing knowledge and best practices to learn every day. You will be working in a world-class media broadcast company, growing your hands-on skills across multiple cloud platforms and projects.
Involvement. You want to grow your exposure to cutting-edge technology and products used in huge international films to elevate the audience experience. You want to influence our cloud infrastructure, introduce best practices, share ideas and knowledge, and see the impact of your insights come to life across our global organization.
What you’ll be doing:
Contribute to projects. You will work on requirements, architecture, and scalability of 3-tier web applications, prioritize security, and draw on best practices to make recommendations across the lifecycle.
Build cloud environments. You will plan, design, create and maintain cloud environments predominantly in AWS. You will adapt to work in GCP and other cloud platforms as needed by our external partners.
Monitor. You will optimize and maintain our Linux systems, check the health of cloud infrastructure through logs, and update infrastructure platforms based on requests.
Collaborate. You will partner with our DevOps team to ensure the maximum efficiency of our build and deploy environment. You will work closely with both software and hardware Engineering teams to improve, expand, or define builds, deployments, infrastructure, architecture, and tools.
What you bring:
The technical expertise. You have 4+ years of related experience in a high-capacity, high-impact, high availability online environment and hands-on experience with:
Linux Administration.
AWS cloud technologies like IAM, KMS, S3, EC2, Autoscale, ELB/ALB, Route53.
Writing and maintaining Cloudformation and Terraform configurations.
Web server technologies such as Apache or Nginx.
RDBMS and NoSQL databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, Cassandra or MongoDB.
The leadership. You take ownership of your deliverables and can coach and guide junior team members to successfully achieve results. You can manage and prioritize multiple initiatives with competing deadlines. You have a creative and analytical approach to problem-solving and a proven track record of researching and introducing new and established technologies, tools, and processes.
The interpersonal skills. You are a collaborator and thought-leader who can influence decisions, adopt the opinions of others, and drive consensus. You have effective and flexible communication skills, and you are comfortable making presentations to stakeholders. You have an appreciation for diverse experiences, cultures, and backgrounds and can work inclusively with global teams.
The flexibility. You understand the nature and demands of a 24/7 always available global environment and can participate in a 24/7 on-call rotation to support our systems.
Our Commitment to you:
For consideration, please apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest in IMAX but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
At IMAX you'll be part of a culture built on respect - one that recognizes the unique talents of everyone on the team. We're proud of the differences that make us all unique and we support unity, acceptance and equal rights for all. Diversity and inclusion among our employees are critical to our success as a global company.
Before you start with IMAX, all employment is subject to background and reference checks. Additionally, our Canada employees are subject to our mandatory Covid-19 vaccine policy.
IMAX is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

This role provides you opportunities to work with a variety of SAP products and technologies in all industry segments. column2: Cloud & Data Engineering Intern – May 2023 (4 Months)
column7:
Introduction
Do you want to use your new technical and programming skills to build fast-paced, 6-week projects for the world’s biggest companies? Do you want to build some of the most innovative and impactful solutions in cloud, trustworthy AI, security, and beyond? If so, join us in IBM Client Engineering!

IBM Client Engineering is a technical pre-sales agile team, helping our customers transform their business. We work directly with our customers in small teams of cloud engineers, data scientists, solution architects, designers, and other experts to co-develop real business solutions. Not only will you get experience across the top brands and industries, but you will also have access to the entire IBM research, services, and product teams to help our customers succeed.

This intern position is for highly talented undergraduate and graduate level students. The role is hands-on. You will grow your technical skills in the most current IBM Cloud and AI solutions, while leveraging open source for leading industries. You will join teams working directly with customers, defining solutions, and leading the way in how they get built.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Client Engineering interns are part of a small entrepreneurial team delivering projects that are co-created with customers using cloud, data science and programming skills. You will become the hands-on subject matter expert in cloud/data application development applying your skills to real business problems. You get to specialize in areas such as cloud, containers, DevOps, edge and IoT, Red Hat OpenShift, RPA, API management, AI solutions, big data, modern data pipelines, and more. You will work with cutting edge IBM technologies such as Watson along with open-source libraries and frameworks.

Intern opportunities are available in either Toronto or Montreal (Candidates applying to the Montreal position must be fluent in French) and are 4-months long.

Successful IBM Client Engineering Interns:
Demonstrate a growth mindset and continuous learning; stay current on IBM strategies and products with hands on technical growth in data science and cloud native computing
Use modern development practices and methods to plan and create cloud and AI applications
Be conversant and knowledgeable about technology trends and how technology is being applied to address business challenges
Demonstrate strong analytic, problem solving, and troubleshooting skills combined with an agile process
Motivated to lead successful projects and meet technical and business objectives
Strong professional verbal, written, and interpersonal skills

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Registered full-time university/college student (must be minimum 2nd year) pursuing bachelor’s degree or post-secondary degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or similar disciplines
Experience in programming with Java, JavaScript, Python, SQL or language in similar discipline
Fluency in French is a mandatory requirement for the Montreal position

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Experience in application development, data engineering, database administration
Experience with technologies such as Git, REST, CI/CD Pipelines, Linux command line, Containers, Kubernetes, databases

About Business Unit
IBM has a global presence, operating in more than 175 countries with a broad-based geographic distribution of revenue. The company’s Global Markets organization is a strategic sales business unit that manages IBM’s global footprint, working closely with dedicated country-based operating units to serve clients locally. These country teams have client relationship managers who lead integrated teams of consultants, solution specialists and delivery professionals to enable clients’ growth and innovation. By complementing local expertise with global experience and digital capabilities, IBM builds deep and broad-based client relationships. This local management focus fosters speed in supporting clients, addressing new markets and making investments in emerging opportunities. Additionally, the Global Markets organization serves clients with expertise in their industry as well as through the products and services that IBM and partners supply. IBM is also expanding its reach to new and existing clients through digital marketplaces.

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities. Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone. It's time to define your career.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement
Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.

This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Syria, and the Crimea, Luhansk and Donetsk regions of Ukraine) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Excellent knowledge of UNIX O/S (Solaris, Linux)

Datacom experience is a plus.

column2: Cloud Architect, AWS Professional Services (Remote role in C...
column7:
Overview

We are expanding our team of motivated technologists with a proven track record of delivering results in technology sales or consulting. The team is looking for a Cloud Architect who's passionate about helping customers with their AWS initiatives. Being an experienced technologist with technical depth and breadth, aided with strong interpersonal skills, you will work directly with customers as part of a delivery team helping to enable innovation through continuous delivery across technology stacks and creating robust solution designs that align to business goals. Your insight and experience will help our delivery teams build architectures and provide prescriptive guidance across network, storage, operating systems, virtualization, RDBMS & NoSQL databases, security, and automation.

The qualified Cloud Architect will have demonstrated the ability to think strategically about businesses, create technical definitions around customer objectives in complex situations, develop solution strategies, motivate & mobilize resources, and deliver results. The ability to connect technology with measurable business value is a critical component to be successful in this role. We seek team members who are self-motivated, driven, collaborative, passionate about AWS and want to have a direct positive impact on our customer's business. Strong communication skills and emotional intelligence are also needed to help develop a team reporting to you. #onica
What you'll be doing
As the Cloud Architect, you will be technically focused but also will understand business planning
Be the technical liaison between customers and engineering resources
Provide tactical scope and work directly with the business representatives/customers to understand the requirements driving the need for a solution to be developed
Communicate effectively with both business and technical colleagues throughout the course of the project
Ensure that all the appropriate questions are asked and verify that nothing crucial to the success of the project is overlooked
Be an AWS evangelist by educating a variety of customers on the value of AWS
Help customers transition to the cloud in a high-value migration approach that leverages best of breed designs and practices delivered in an agile model.
Work with customers to enable a DevOps culture and modernize operations and release strategies
Establish credibility and build impactful relationships with our customers to enable them to be cloud advocates
Lead and participate in deep architectural discussions to build confidence and ensure customer success when building new, or migrating existing, applications, software and services on the AWS platform.
Conduct deep-dive “hands-on” education/training sessions to transfer knowledge to customers interested in AWS and to ensure our SAs are up to date
Attend and present valuable information at Industry Events
Requirements
7+ years design & implementation experience with distributed applications and/or infrastructure design
5+ years of experience in networking, infrastructure, or database architectures
3+ years of "hands-on" AWS implementation
Knowledge of IaC, CI/CD, DevOps implementation
Demonstrated knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT management, and developers
Excellent communication skills with an ability to right level conversations
Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
Leadership skills to effectively communicate and manage a technical team
Nice to have
5+ years’ of experience in customer-facing software/technology or consulting
Minimum 3+ years’ of experience with “on-premises to cloud” migrations or IT transformations
Minimum 3+ years’ of experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS (ideally) or other Cloud platforms
Technical degree; Computer Science or related
AWS Certified Solutions Architect Professional certification

We are the multicloud solutions experts. We combine our expertise with the world’s leading technologies — across applications, data and security — to deliver end-to-end solutions. We have a proven record of advising customers based on their business challenges, designing solutions that scale, building and managing those solutions, and optimizing returns into the future. Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. Join us on our mission to embrace technology, empower customers and deliver the future.

More on Rackspace Technology
Though we’re all different, Rackers thrive through our connection to a central goal: to be a valued member of a winning team on an inspiring mission. We bring our whole selves to work every day. And we embrace the notion that unique perspectives fuel innovation and enable us to best serve our customers and communities around the globe.
