Our client is a world wide, Fortune 500 telecom vendor working across technologies such as 5G, Cloud, Networking and much more. They are currently seeking to add a Cloud Architect to their team for a long term, potentially multi-year contract.


Our Exciting Opportunity
Our client is looking for a Software/System Architect to analyze, design and prototyping on business requirements and prototyping on new technologies to be incorporated into our tools and platforms.

Your role will include all development activities such as: requirement analysis, architecture & software design including low level, integration, verification, troubleshooting and system documentation. You will also take charge of non-functional attributes of the system such as security, system upgrades, capacity & performance, stability. We are Lean and Agile organization in which continuous improvement, innovation and knowledge sharing is part of the daily work.

In this role you will:
Set architectural vision and direction across a matrix of solutions and components
• Provide technical leadership and drive design and development of system architectures • Develop high and low-level software designs for various business needs
Work with stakeholders to define non-functional requirements and take charge to implement
Ensure that the data and infrastructure is protected using the appropriate security controls
Collaborate with other areas on design and implementation of big and sophisticated systems involving software components and services
Develop competence in business and technical domains
Participate in Architecture Board meetings

To be successful in the role you must have:
Solid experience in containerization (Docker/Kubernetes) and Microservice Architecture
Solid experience in Web Application development using Java
Experience in ElasticSearch and PostGres
Experience with building system and software architectures and implementing non[1]functional requirements including data and platform security
Experience in designing, developing, and handling sophisticated and large-scale solutions
Must be knowledgeable in software development lifecycles/methodologies (agile/waterfall)
Basic knowledge in DevSecOps toolkit and Cloud platforms
Self-driven demeanor and ability to work autonomously with little support
Interpersonal communication and presentation skills

Sr. Cloud Architect
What You’ll Do
As a member of the Digital Architecture Team, you will lead our efforts to design and build critical eCommerce services in the cloud. You are the go-to expert for the architecture and design of cloud-based distributed microservices platforms on Azure. You have a deep understanding of the capabilities, limitations and design patterns for Azure components, and how to use them to deliver positive customer outcomes. You are experienced with microservices integration and orchestration patterns in large enterprises, and how to implement them in Azure. This role owns the solution architecture for the Azure infrastructure, Kubernetes platform, and related services supporting eCommerce.
Lead the architecture of cloud-based solutions on Azure with a focus on infrastructure, microservices, and data integrations
Design pipelines and configurations to support automated provisioning of Azure based infrastructure and services using Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
Lead projects, create architectural artifacts, coach, mentor, and encourage team members
Modernize engineering practices and on-going cloud infrastructure optimization
Partner with multiple technical and business stakeholders providing technical expertise for cloud related issues
Drive investigation and adoption of new and emerging cloud capabilities (e.g. Serverless)Focus on cost optimization for cloud-based workloads
Manage team priorities and delivery of cloud infrastructure requirements through agile delivery
Work with the SRE team to ensure cloud-based solutions provide sufficient telemetry to support SLAs and operations
Provide hands-on-keyboard support to the team where required
What You Bring
Degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent relevant experience
7+ years I.T. experience in progressive analysis and design related positions
5+ years of experience deploying cloud-based solutions
5+ years of experience implementing foundational cloud services (networking, security, account/organizations, logging & monitoring, identity access management, etc.)
3+ years hands-on experience operating cloud based microservices and workloads with a demonstrated ability maintain high availability, secure and automated deployments
3+ years designing, implementing, and supporting Azure infrastructure and topologies
At least one Azure Certification
Strong hands-on experience with cloud automation and orchestration tooling and practices including git, terraform, ADO/GitHub, ARM or equivalents
Strong hands-on experience with microservices tooling such as Docker, Kubernetes, service mesh, API Gateways
Strong experience working with storage and messaging services such as Azure Service Bus, Azure Blob Storage, RDMS, and NoSQL
Experience interpreting and applying security best practices to create, harden and secure infrastructure and applications
Strong architectural experience in public cloud container services (AKS)
Understanding of microservices based applications/development using NodeJS (preferred) and cloud-based services
Understanding of the cloud ecosystem and leading-edge emerging technologies (e.g. Serverless)
Understanding of event-driven/reactive architectures and integrations
Experience configuring and tuning virtual private clouds
Understanding of TLS/SSL, encryption, and key management principles
Experience with Cloud-native KMS and/or HashiCorp Vault
Experience working in an Agile environment
Excellent analytics, problem solving and solutioning skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Job Type: Fixed term contract
Contract length: 6 months
Flexible Language Requirement:
French not required
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Day shift

Cloud architecture: 8 years (required)

Azure (preferred)

Job Type: Permanent
Reference code: 120001
Primary Location: Toronto, ON
All Available Locations: Toronto, ON

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.
Be part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary Canada.
Grow your network and your knowledge by joining one of our many Employee Resource Groups.
-
What will your typical day look like?

As a Solution Architect, you will guide the design, build and integration of our enterprise solutions for various domains and technologies for the firm.

You will establish and maintain adherence to standard enterprise architecture principles and patterns.
Working with the delivery teams, you will enforce standards, best practices and methodologies and enable maturity of system engineering, quality assurance and analysis. You will be a mentor and a leader to the delivery teams to ensure their growth as well.
You will carry out technology assessments, pilots, prototypes or proof of concepts, where applicable, to further capabilities provided by our technology stack.
You will work with the team to innovate and expand our business application implementations, capabilities, features and strategic technology roadmap.
You will collaborate with enterprise architects to ensure solutions fit and scale into a larger picture. You will interact with Infrastructure, Security and Privacy, Portfolio, Business and IT leadership representatives. You have strong interpersonal skills and have a demonstrated ability to work with nuanced and complex concepts.
About the team

The Chief Experience Office (CEXPO) team is responsible for most products/systems within the Enabling Area Services under the Solutions Delivery group within Deloitte’s ITS organization (Information Technology Services). The application portfolio spans across multiple solution categories catering to various key business units.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you

You are someone with:

University degree or equivalent work experience
Strong commitment to professional client service excellence
Demonstrated knowledge of agile project methodology
5+ years’ experience designing and architecting solutions
Comes from a full-stack development background with deep experience in the following technologies: C#, Angular/ReactJS, MSSQL
Developed cloud-enabled solutions with Azure services and technologies
Has experience with domain-driven-design and microservice oriented architecture principles and patterns

Our promise to our people: Deloitte is where potential comes to life.

Be yourself, and more.
We are a group of talented people who want to learn, gain experience, and develop skills. Wherever you are in your career, we want you to advance.
You shape how we make impact.
Diverse perspectives and life experiences make us better. Whoever you are and wherever you’re from, we want you to feel like you belong here. We provide flexible working options to support you and how you can contribute. Be the leader you want to be.
Be the leader you want to be
Some guide teams, some change culture, some build essential expertise. We offer opportunities and experiences that support your continuing growth as a leader.
Have as many careers as you want.

We bring together people with unique experiences and talents, and we are the place to develop a lasting network of friends, peers, and mentors. Our TVP is about relationships – between leaders and their people, the firm and its people, peers, and within in our communities.

The next step is yours

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.
We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!
By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. Growth mindset encourages each of us to lean in and learn what matters most to our customers, to create the foundational knowledge that enables us to make customer-first decisions in everything we do. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us achieve our mission.

Azure is the most comprehensive, innovative and flexible cloud platform today and Microsoft is hiring professionals that will drive customer cloud adoption within the most important companies in the market. We are always learning. Insatiably curious. We lean into uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from our mistakes. We build on each other’s ideas because we are better together. We stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve and are motivated every day to empower others to do more and achieve more through our technology and innovation. Together we make a difference.

To learn more about Microsoft’s mission, please visit: https://careers.microsoft.com/mission-culture

Check out all of our products at: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us. Microsoft aspires to help our customers achieve their own digital transformation, leveraging the power of Microsoft Cloud solutions and services. To this end, Microsoft is investing in a dedicated Customer Success team member that will help the largest and most important companies in the world across all industries successfully adopt Microsoft Cloud solution and services.

Who We Are Looking For

We are looking for a highly motivated and passionate Cloud Solution Architect for the Digital & App Innovation team to drive high priority customer initiatives on the Microsoft Azure Platform in collaboration with customers and the Microsoft field in the enterprise accounts segment of our business. This is a customer facing role, owning the overall technical relationship between the customer and Microsoft Azure Applications Development Platform. You will own the Azure Applications Development technical customer engagements including architectural design sessions, specific implementation projects and/or pilots. The ideal candidate will have experience in customer-facing roles and success leading technical architecture discussions with senior customer executives, Enterprise Architects, IT Management and Developers.

Responsibilities
Key responsibilities include:

Understanding Customer Technical Environment

Gathers customer insights (e.g., feedback around technical preferences, environments, business needs, competitive landscape), and maps architecture and digital transformation solutions to customer business outcomes. Adapts business models, plans, and solutions to insights.
Acts as the voice of the customer (VOC) by driving new feedback, gaps, blockers, insights, resources, etc. across communities to track, add, and prioritize, using established channels (e.g., UAT/TFT).
Architecture Design and Deployment

Leverages and champions an existing architecture approach to achieve Microsoft's agreed commitments to the customer. Identifies growth opportunities based on knowledge of customer needs.
Receives and synthesizes data about customer business and technical requirements, addresses them with technical architecture(s), and demonstrates and proves those solutions capability and business value through design collaboration sessions with the customer.
Applies broad technical knowledge across various of architecture solutions to meet business and information technology (IT) requirements and resolve identified technical constraints. helps to shape and enhance customers' requirements.
Leads customer projects that implement technical architecture(s). Provides thought leadership for technical architecture design, development, and deployment and supports/drives the customer throughout pre-sales and/or implementation.
Identifies, escalates, and works to resolve technical blockers (e.g., changing configurations, sample coding) to accelerate architecture implementations and routes non-technical issues for removal by the appropriate party.
Adapts methodology and applies governance to identify, communicate, and minimize business and technical risks (e.g. Well-Architected Framework, Enterprise Scale Landing Zone, Cloud Adoption Framework).
Defines customer conditions of success, adheres to quality assurance, and calculates risks while designing and/or delivering solutions.
Practice Development

Generates new ideas for changes and improvements to existing intellectual property (IP), technologies, and processes for designated customers. drives opportunities for IP re-use, best practice sharing, and consumption.
Trusted Advisor

Develops and expands existing impactful relationships with customer and partner/MCS architects, C-level technical decision makers (TDMs), and business stakeholders
Respectfully challenges customers when going in the wrong direction and escalates appropriately.
Understands the competitor's architecture solutions and identifies Microsoft's strengths over competitive solutions to drive conversations with customers and convince them of solution.
Thought Leadership

Shares ideas, insight, and strategic, technical input with technical teams, internal communities across the field, and the larger virtual team across Microsoft using a thorough knowledge of specific Microsoft products and their context in the competitive landscape.
Participates in external architect community events (e.g., conferences, seminars, technical meetups, Webcasts, blogs, hackathons) and shares learnings with the internal team.
Acts a mentor to junior colleagues to educate them on technical and non-technical concepts.
Customer Usage

Leads architecture design, resiliency reviews, and technical optimization across multiple applications for the customer, resulting in production deployment application and increased customer business value.
Drives efforts to ensure that the customer's environment and applications are well-architected.
#AIFY23H1
Qualifications
Qualifications
6+ years experience in technology solutions, practice development, architecture, consulting, and/or cloud/infrastructure technologies
Enterprise-scale technical experience with cloud and hybrid infrastructures, architecture designs, migrations, and technology management.
Subject matter expertise in one or more of the following:
Application development platforms on public clouds and/or Azure in development languages such as Java, JavaScript, Python, PHP, C#, Node.JS
Scalable architectures using Azure App Service, API management, serverless technologies, container orchestration (e.g. AKS, Kubernetes, Red Hat OpenShift etc.), microservice frameworks etc.
Software development practices like DevOps and CI/CD tool chains (i.e. GitHub, Azure DevOps, Jenkins, Spinnaker)
Certification in one of the following technologies preferred: cloud-native application architecture (i.e. containers, microservices, API management), modern software development techniques like DevOps and CI/CD tool chains and container orchestration systems (i.e. Docker, Kubernetes, Red Hat OpenShift, Cloud Foundry, Azure Kubernetes Service, GitHub)
Advanced Knowledge of Java, Kubernetes, RedHat OpenShift and/or PCF Desired
4+ years technical sales experience preferred
4+ years project management experience preferred
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field preferred
Fluency in English and French preferred

BS in computer science, computer engineering, or equivalent.
Experience in development/configuration of Portal and IAM solutions
Extensive experience working with API’s / Web Services (RESTful and SOAP)
Extensive development experience in JavaScript, Java, and JS UI Frameworks.

Do you enjoy working on high-scale, complex, and high visibility projects and programs? If yes, consider the following opportunity:

Rogers is seeking Cloud Engineers (CE) to be accountable for developing Cloud engineering solutions, best practices, automation and technical design specifications for large scale and complex technology projects. Reporting to the Sr. Manager - Cloud Engineering, the Cloud Engineer (CE) owns all solution design and build deliverables for the complete technology stack that supports the client's applications and business processes. The CE follows recommended patterns, enterprise standards, and architectural requirements to design and implement solutions in coordination with application and technology delivery groups.

What you will be doing...
The primary responsibility is to research, design, implement best practices for public cloud.
Analyze requirements and create designs for public cloud infrastructure and platform services.
Create best practices documentation for Public Cloud Services.
Play cloud SME role in current active Rogers projects to identify and recommend cost effective infra solution.
Assisting Rogers Cloud Governance team with right sizing and developing cloud infra cost estimates.
Supporting, Maintaining & Developing new enhancements in Enterprise AWS/Azure public Cloud.
Develop and maintain IaC (Infrastructure as Code) and CICD Pipeline. Maintain Rogers Enterprise Cloud infrastructure Service Catalog.
Assist engineering leadership analyzing public, hybrid, PaaS, IaaS, SaaS options and defining a multiyear platform deployment plan.
Collaborate with application development teams to gather functional and non-functional requirements for a specific project and articulate how the solution addresses those requirements.
Document all configuration, management and optimization changes to the cloud environment.
Ensure cloud engineered solutions conform to Rogers' cloud patterns, reference architectures, principles and methodologies.
Develop evaluation criteria and make recommendations for the selection of the software and hardware components of the solution.
Develop detailed deployment specifications for cloud resources, management platforms and operational tools necessary to ensure target SLAs either met or exceeded.
Support the implementation of documented solutions into operational platforms by delivery and operational teams.
Identify project risks and participate in defining risk mitigation and control activities.
Work with 3rd party vendors to evaluate and deploy their services into public cloud.
Incorporate security requirements into the design, understand and comply with Rogers' cyber security standards and policies.
Work with Rogers Security team to identify and implement Rogers security controls in public cloud Enterprise service catalog.

What you have...
Computer Science / IT/ Engineering Degree education required.
Good Experience in working with 3rd party vendors.
Certification, experience and/or training related to Cloud & Service Delivery Frameworks (TOGAF, Microsoft, Amazon, eTOM, ITIL, etc.). Plus
Deep knowledge of infrastructure and platform services on cloud platform (Azure and AWS).
Core understanding of different cloud service models ( IaaS , PaaS , SaaS , etc ).
Experience designing, building and supporting Azure / AWS / OCI Public Cloud Platforms.
2+ years of experience as cloud professional (Architect, Associate, Developer) or comparable role, demonstrating applied architectural experience, both conceptual and logical in implementing complex technology environments.
Knowledge with containers, microservices patterns and API`s.
Cloud networking patterns and services, such as load balancing, overlay networking, VPN and multi-datacenter networking. plus
2+ years prior experience in a technical role, demonstrating the technical design and practical implementation of complex infrastructure solutions in an enterprise environment; Telecom sector experience is an asset.
2+ years of experience with the design and implementation of a broad range of infrastructure solutions – server/compute platforms, high availability and disaster recovery design, n-tier infrastructure, security integration, database platforms, storage infrastructure, IT service management.
Experience establishing a strategy for and implementing cloud enterprise solutions in Microsoft Azure and/or AWS/OCI
Experience with technology product evaluation, selection, acquisition and deployment processes.
Experience with the preparation of technical design, implementation, system administration and operational documentation.
Experience in designing, deploying and supporting high availability (multi-zone and multi-region architectures).
Experience designing and building AWS/Azure Public Cloud at enterprise level.
Familiarity with continuous deployment methodology and common DevOps tools such as Git, Jenkins, terraform and configuration tools such as Chef, Puppet and Ansible
Experience with Azure Resource Manager (ARM) and AWS Code* template tools is a plus

Job Summary
AWS Professional Services (ProServe) consultants help the world’s largest enterprises achieve breakthrough business results by leveraging the AWS platform. They collaborate with customers and partners to address security and compliance, performance and scale, availability, and manageability. They enable customers to migrate existing systems and build new systems using the full range of AWS services.
As we continue to enable our customers’ success, we are looking for an experienced Portfolio Manager who will support developing the long-term vision and direction for an Area’s portfolio across various engagements and standards for delivering excellence in collaboration with ProServe Customer Practice Managers, Engagement Managers, Customer Delivery Architects, and Commercial Sales teams. You must be comfortable working with external and internal customers to understand their needs. A successful candidate will work effectively in a matrixed organization and be adept at managing multiple work streams simultaneously to build repeatable and scalable processes for projects and programs.

AWS server integrations Provide guidance, advisory, oversight, and support to the project delivery teams ensuring delivery aspects are handled to ProServe standards.

Manage the portfolio and create scale, be a force multiplier across the portfolio and work through the EMs to ensure consistency and a group of best practices that an Area Leader can rely on.
Provide insights to an Area Leader and SPM/CPMs on change orders and work at-risk issues.

Act as the customer reference champion and increase the number of Customer References for the area.

Curate and grow the pool of reusable assets and mechanisms that result from the area’s delivered engagements.
Work closely with sales to support and influence the growth of ProServe KPIs and customer business outcomes.
Master’s degree or equivalent experience
Managed and delivered IT engagements for a Fortune 100 and Fortune 500 Company
Experience delivering professional services in a high-growth environment
Broad technical breadth and depth, including familiarity with AWS and Enterprise IT infrastructure.

Next-gen operations at scale, with pure Python infra-as-code, from bare metal to containers and applications. Our goal is to perfect enterprise infrastructure devops.
We run hundreds of private cloud, Kubernetes, and application clusters for customers across physical and public cloud estate, and we are raising the bar on what's possible with automation by embracing a universal operator pattern and model-driven operations.
To succeed in this role you need to believe in automation as a pure software engineering problem, not a hack-it-till-it-works-for-me problem. You need to be interested in the scientific approach to operations at scale, driven by metrics and code, and you need to be able to learn the entire stack, from bare metal networking and kernel up to serverless and open source applications.
Cloud Operations Engineer
Our cloud operations engineers bring Python software-engineering skills and rigour to the operations domain. We practice devsecops from bare metal to application. We architect and run OpenStack, Kubernetes and software defined storage, and we enable devsecops for applications running on that infrastructure too.
To become a member of this team, you need to be a software engineer fluent in Python, you need a genuine interest in the full open source infrastructure stack from metal to containers, and you need the ability to work in a high pressure operations environment with mission-critical services for global brand name customers.
As a member of the team you will gain experience in a broad range of cloud technologies. We evolve our offerings as the state of the art improves, so you get to stay current with the latest capabilities in open source infrastructure. We drive upgrades to keep our customers on the latest, best solutions.
What Canonical Offers
Technical management team that understands the details of what we are developing
A culture of openness and inclusiveness
Helpful and talented engineers who are world-class experts in many fields
Teams focused on good work life balance with long average retention rates
A wide range of engineering disciplines and career paths that can move between divisions
Fully remote company for career growth without relocation requirements
Requirements
Software Engineering or Computer Science degree
Linux experience and familiarity with Linux networking and storage
Python software development experience
Demonstrated drive for continual learning
Devops experience
Nice to haves
Experience with OpenStack or Kubernetes deployment or operations
We hope that you'll join us in helping to shape and build the future of free software together
Of course we also offer...
Learning and Development
Annual Compensation Review
Recognition Rewards
Annual Leave
Priority Pass for travel
Flexible working option

column2: GCP Cloud Architect - Professional Services (Remote role in...
column7:
Overview
We are expanding our team of motivated technologists with a proven track record of delivering results in technology consulting. Specifically looking for a GCP Cloud Architect who's passionate about helping customers build applications at scale. Being an experienced technologist with technical depth and breadth, aided with strong interpersonal skills, you will work directly with customers as part of a professional services delivery team helping to enable innovation through continuous delivery across technology stacks and creating robust solution designs that align to business goals. Your insight and experience will help our delivery teams build architectures and provide prescriptive guidance across network, storage, operating systems, virtualization, RDBMS & NoSQL databases, security, and automation. In addition, you will work with mid-tier technologies that include application integration, in-memory caches, security, and much more!
The qualified GCP Cloud Architect will have demonstrated the ability to think strategically about businesses, create technical definitions around customer objectives in complex situations, develop solution strategies, motivate & mobilize resources, and deliver results. The ability to connect technology with measurable business value is a critical component to be successful in this role. We seek team members who are self-motivated, driven, collaborative, passionate about Google Cloud and want to have a direct positive impact on our customer's business. Strong communication skills and emotional intelligence are also needed to help develop a team reporting to you.
What you'll be doing
As the GCP Cloud Architect, you will be technically focused but also will understand and implement business planning
Be the technical liaison between customers and engineering resources
Assess cloud needs and provide best practices recommendations on networking, infrastructure, and architecture.
Identify gaps or risks / issues with existing or new designs and technology solutions and develop approaches to remediate those risks.
Provide tactical scope and work directly with the business representatives/customers to understand the requirements driving the need for a solution to be developed
Collaborate closely with team members, clients, and other teams
Communicate effectively with both business and technical colleagues throughout the course of the project
Ensure that all the appropriate questions are asked and verify that nothing crucial to the success of the project is overlooked
Be a Google Cloud evangelist by educating a variety of customers on the value of GCP
Help customers transition to the cloud in a high-value migration approach that leverages best of breed designs and practices delivered in an agile model
Work with customers to enable a DevOps culture and modernize operations and release strategies
Establish credibility and build impactful relationships with our customers to enable them to be cloud advocates
Participate in deep architectural discussions to build confidence and ensure customer success when building new, or migrating existing, applications, software and services on the Google Cloud Platform.
Conduct deep-dive “hands-on” education/training sessions to transfer knowledge to customers interested in GCP and to ensure our SAs are up to date
Traveling up to 25% of the time (When traveling continues)
Requirements
5+ years design & implementation experience with distributed applications
5+ years of experience in networking, infrastructure, or database architectures
Google Cloud Professional Cloud Architect certification and/or other Google Cloud certifications
In depth understanding and professional experience with GCP services and infrastructure
Expertise in the deployment and orchestration of container technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, GKE)
Experience migrating and refactoring solutions to Google Cloud
"Hands on" experience with practices and services related to Automation, IaC and DevOps (e.g., Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins)
Demonstrated knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT management, and developers
Excellent communication skills with an ability to right level conversations
Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
Nice to have
5+ years’ of experience in customer-facing software/technology or consulting
3+ years’ of experience with “on-premises to cloud” migrations or IT transformations
3+ years’ of experience architecting/operating solutions built on GCP (ideally) or AWS/Azure
Technical degree; Computer Science or related
Sponsorship
This role is not sponsorship eligible

About Rackspace Technology
We are the multicloud solutions experts. We combine our expertise with the world’s leading technologies — across applications, data and security — to deliver end-to-end solutions. We have a proven record of advising customers based on their business challenges, designing solutions that scale, building and managing those solutions, and optimizing returns into the future. Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. Join us on our mission to embrace technology, empower customers and deliver the future.

More on Rackspace Technology

Solutions Architect
LOCATION: Canada OR USA - this position is fully remote, but applicant must be physically located in the US or Canada

ABOUT GRIDGAIN
When it comes to enterprise applications, microseconds matter. And when organizations need extreme speed and scale, they turn to GridGain Systems. GridGain is the company behind Apache Ignite, the open-source distributed database preferred by performance-obsessed developers. We are also the provider of the GridGain In-memory Computing Platform that JPMorgan Chase, ING, Citi, UPS, American Airlines, DreamWorks, CMA CGM, IBM, VMware, Microsoft, and United Healthcare rely on for application speed, scale, and availability.

GridGain is growing. So, now's the time to join the company that, in 2021, was recognized among Silicon Valley Business Journal Fastest Growing Private Companies, the Deloitte Technology Fast 500, and the Inc. 5000.

ABOUT THE ROLE
We are seeking a Solutions Architect to join our Sales team and help build upon the tremendous growth GridGain has experienced over the past few years.

Location: This is a remote position. Candidates may be based anywhere in the United States or Canada. We are looking to fill multiple positions for this role.

This hands-on customer-facing role will be a key part of the Sales organization responsible for getting GridGain the technical win in a highly competitive sales environment. As a Solutions Architect at GridGain, you will work with prospects at all levels, from Executives to technical architects and developers through a guided discovery process to understand their key business and technical requirements. You will translate their requirements into a solution that highlights GridGain’s technical value proposition and, in collaboration with our Sales, Marketing and Engineering teams, you will design, coordinate, and deliver a tailored Proof of Concept to demonstrate key technical use cases.

Required Job Duties:
Own and manage the technical relationship with the prospect or technology partner.
Provide technical leadership through the entire pre-sales process, including presentations, PoC development and delivery.
Understand, quantify, and validate the business needs of prospects and their specific use cases.
Present and demonstrate the GridGain platform and appropriate solutions to stakeholders at all levels, including executives, technical architects, and developers.
Articulate GridGain’s unique value propositions, positioning and competitive differentiators.
Conduct technical workshops, lunch & learn sessions, and formal training, as needed.
Maintain deep and up to date knowledge of the GridGain product stack, competitive products, and technologies.
Build strong relationships, collaborate with people across the organization and leverage available resources to get the job done.
Support GridGain in its developer outreach through participation in Meetups, technical conferences, and webinars.

Essential Skills & Requirements:
B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
5+ years of experience in enterprise architecture, technical pre-sales and/or consulting.
5+ years of solution architecture and design experience with Java EE based systems.
5+ years of hands-on development experience, 3+ years Java or .Net development experience a plus.
Experience with data modeling for OLTP and OLAP systems, SQL programming and query optimization.
Must have a solid technical background related to or adjacent to in-memory computing (i.e.: in-memory caching, distributed computing, distributed data stores, data streaming, MapReduce design pattern, etc.).
Solid understanding of concurrency and multithreaded programming.
Thorough understanding of Hadoop, as well as MapReduce design pattern.
Experience working with cloud infrastructure and containerized environments, including scripting for k8s, Terraform, etc.
Strong knowledge of network programming and understanding of networking protocols.
Superb verbal communication skills including a dynamic and engaging presentation style.
Experience in scoping, planning and management of technical projects.
Experience in collaborating with and leading cross-functional teams.
Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization.
Highly organized, detail-oriented, excellent time-management skills and able to effectively prioritize tasks in a fast-paced, high-volume, and evolving work environment.

Join SADA as a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer - Observability!
Your Mission
As a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer - Observability at SADA, you will work collaboratively to deliver high quality observability solutions on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) for our cloud and hybrid-cloud customers. You should be familiar with instrumentation techniques, monitoring and distributed systems, and you should have experience working with market-leading observability platforms like New Relic and Dynatrace to detect and diagnose performance bottlenecks based on telemetry data.
You will have an opportunity to work on real-world problems facing our customers in the field. While this position primarily focuses on observability platform delivery projects, you will also be required to be hands-on deliver on other GCP focused projects that cover a range of domain areas, such as workload migrations from on-prem or other clouds to GCP, standing up experimental infrastructures on GCP, building hybrid-cloud solutions on top of Kubernetes and Anthos, and developing fully automated CI/CD pipelines.
You possess a diverse background in areas such as application design, distributed systems, application performance management, and deployment strategies. To be successful, one must know how to navigate ambiguity, have extensive experience working with cloud technologies, have technical depth, and enjoy working with customers.
In this role, you will:
Be expected to tackle all technical challenges on whole projects and should be able to work independently, but should be a major participant in team reviews.
Be recognized as having technical mastery within the practice with an established reputation with Google and our customers.
Have demonstrable experience with public facing activities such as blogs, presentations, webinars, and OSS contributions.
Ensure the best architecture and engineering approach is applied. You will be expected to repeatedly deliver complex projects, including complex technical components of the engagement.

Pathway to Success
#MakeThemRave is at the foundation of every project our engineering teams take on. Our singular goal is to provide customers with the best possible experience in migrating, building, modernizing, and operationalizing their systems in Google Cloud Platform.
Your success starts by positively impacting the direction of a dynamic practice with vision and passion. You will be measured quarterly by the breadth, magnitude, and quality of your contributions, your ability to estimate accurately, customer feedback at the close of projects, how well you collaborate with your peers, and the consultative polish you bring to customer interactions.
As you continue to execute successfully, we will build a customized development plan together that leads you through the engineering or management growth tracks.

Expectations
Required Travel - 10% travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events.
Customer Facing - You are required to be on customer calls for the duration of the project that you are assigned to. These calls can be sometimes daily, weekly, bi-weekly or as scheduled by the project manager or the customer. Common touch points occur when qualifying potential opportunities, at project kickoff, throughout the engagement as progress is communicated, and at project close. You can expect to interact with a range of customer stakeholders, including engineers, technical project managers, and executives.
Onboarding/Training - The first few weeks of onboarding are dedicated to learning and will encompass learning materials/assignments and compliance training, as well as meetings with relevant individuals. Details of the timeline are shared closer to the start date.

Job Requirements
Required Credentials:
Google Cloud Architect Certified or able to complete within the first 45 days of employment.
Required Qualifications:
Strong experience creating/supporting/maintaining application infrastructure on-premise and cloud (preferably GCP).
Applied experience setting up resources for applications that run on Linux and/or Windows, i.e web servers, application servers, databases.
Experience implementing and supporting observability platforms in a production environment.
Create monitoring dashboards as per design for various audiences within the organization.
Integrate popular languages, frameworks and cloud providers using the patterns suggested by the observability platform.
Experience with setting up monitoring for various implementations of an application, i.e browser and mobile. Strong familiarity with Synthetic and network monitoring.
Applied experience using queries against aggregated logs.
Experience delivering immutable infrastructure-as-code solutions using tools like Terraform, Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Salt and Packer.
Experience delivering continuous integration/continuous delivery pipelines, utilizing techniques like blue/green and canary deployments, with tools such as Jenkins, CircleCI, TravisCI, and Spinnaker.
Experience writing software in one or more languages such as Go and Python.
Working knowledge of Windows and Linux operating systems to the extent necessary for configuration and hosting applications.
Useful Qualifications
Knowledge and understanding of industry trends and new technologies and the ability to apply trends to architectural needs.
Proven experience and understanding of architecture principles across infrastructure platforms, security, data, integration, and application layers.
Experience working with containerization technologies (Kubernetes, Docker, etc)
Experience with information security practices and procedures
Strong working knowledge of VMware, KVM, Xen, Hyper-V, or other virtualization software

Overview:
At KPMG, you’ll join a team of diverse and dedicated problem solvers, connected by a common cause: turning insight into opportunity for clients and communities around the world.

The Opportunity
KPMG is looking for a highly motivated and passionate Cloud Network Engineer to drive high priority initiatives on Microsoft Azure platform. In this role, you will be responsible for understanding challenges related to application modernization and provide cloud native network architecture and design solutions that are secure, reliable, scalable, and highly available. This role would also assist the current Audit application team with network solution and designs for their suite of applications (IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS). To be successful in this role you should have subject matter expertise in planning, implementing, and maintaining Azure networking solutions as well as significant knowledge of datacenter networking solutions and designs, including hybrid networking, connectivity, routing, security, and private access to Azure service, be an excellent communicator, and have a get the job done attitude and mindset.
What you will do:
Responsible for architecting next-generation cloud-native network solutions
Collaborate with global architects, Canadian Architecture, Operations and Security teams to design, deploy and maintain cloud networking solutions for KPMG Canada.
Collaborating with internal KPMG ITS Audit support team as well as KPMG global audit team to implement, support, manage, administer KPMG audit networking and connectivity requirements from both an on-premises to cloud native perspective. Provide guidance and input into the application from a network infrastructure perspective to leverage cloud native services
Collaborate with technical teams on defining cloud network architecture standards and best practices, providing consistent recommendations and oversight to team members
Understand KPMG’s digital strategy, cloud platform capabilities, IT and business priorities and success measures to design implementation network architectures and solutions
Ensure that network solutions exhibit high levels of performance, security, scalability, maintainability, appropriate reusability, and reliability upon deployment
Develop deep relationships with key customer IT decision makers, who drive long-term Cloud adoption within the firm to enable them to be Cloud advocates
What you bring to this role:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related STEM field or work experience
3+ years of architecting and designing Cloud network solutions focusing on Azure
Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert and\or Azure Network Engineer Associate preferred but not required
Knowledge of core networking concepts (ex: TCP/IP, MPLS, EI, DNS, LAN/WAN, VPN, Internet connectivity)
Knowledge of L4-7 networking concepts (ex: HTTPS, Load balancing, SD-WAN)
Knowledge of network security concepts (ex: SSL/TLS, Palo Alto Firewalls)
Prior work experience in a Consulting/Architecture position within a software and/or services company such as Amazon, Google, IBM, Oracle, and professional services firms would be an asset
Troubleshoot incidents, identify root cause, fix, and document problems, and implement preventive measures
Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud-based network initiatives, providing associated training as required
Employ exceptional problem-solving skills, with the ability to see and solve issues before they affect business productivity
Experience engineering\architecting cloud native and on-premises datacenter networking solutions
Strong understanding of Cloud Native Architecture and principles and Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of and experience using PowerShell, Python, and Shell Scripting languages
Knowledge of CI/CD Systems, such as Azure DevOps server and Azure DevOps services
Experience in Cloud automation using, Azure CLI, ARM & Terraform to enable Infrastructure as a Code
Fundamental understanding and experience with DevOps tools and services (Azure DevOps and Github)
Experience and knowledge of Operating Systems including Windows and Linux
Confidence and ability to lead discussions with clear goals, deliverables, documented agreements and follow up actions
Ability to participate in fast-paced DevOps and System Engineering teams within Scrum Agile processes
Significant experience working in Azure. Added experience working with AWS and GCP is a plus.

Keys to your success

Mature and holistic understanding of cloud technologies
Diligent, hardworking, and goal oriented
Strong team member with great time management skills

Introduction

At IBM, our Project Managers excel by leading and coordinating a project team’s overall performance, scope, cost, and deliverables. Our clients rely on timely and efficient status reports, and as a Project Manager Assistant, you will drive the charge with project direction, metric definition, and performance management.
The IBM Expert Labs practice contains Architects, Product Specialists and Project Managers with deep product skills that can help accelerate a client journey to maximize the value of a software implementation. The engagement sizes range from strategy and quick start deployments to First of a Kind (FOAK) implementations.
If you are ready to help our clients and project teams succeed, we would love to meet you!

Your Role and Responsibilities

The primary responsibility of the Project Manager Assistant (PMA) is to provide administration for IBM’s contractual responsibilities. This includes working with IBMers as well as third-party vendors. In this role, PMA will be responsible to provide project management support to review the Statement of Work (SOW) and the contractual responsibilities of both parties with the client.
The PMA works tasks independently but keeps the Project Manager and leadership promptly apprised of work status, raising issues of risk to the appropriate level with oversight from a Project Manager. In small projects, the PMA is responsible for the overall project plan, budget, structure, and schedule for the delivery organization.
Primary Job responsibilities
Work with Project Managers to provide a framework to Cloud and Cognitive Software (C&CS) Expert Labs project teams
Coordinate and manage the activities of project personnel
Create Project Management deliverables
Maintain project communications with the client
Create regular status reports
Conduct regular status meetings with clients and project stakeholders
Provide monthly financial forecasts to Project Managers
Keep management cadence with the Project Manager and Delivery Leaders to provide insight on project status
Develop knowledge of C&CS Expert Labs offerings with awareness on emerging technologies and solutions
Administer the contract change control procedure with the client
Review the SOW and the contractual responsibilities of both parties with your Project Manager
Ensure Project Health is updated and maintained internally
Provide Forecasting on projects you own
Ensure Project Burn Rate is maintained and accurate
Report utilization of project billing
Perform Invoice reconciliation
Perform monthly financial forecasting
Perform resource onboarding and tracking
Manage the Project Control Book and Project Repository
Administer the Project Change Control Procedure for SOW changes


Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Ability to participate in a virtual office setting and maintain an active and dynamic presence via phone and email
Have initiative to actively seek new knowledge and improve skills
Knowledge of effective self-management practices; ability to manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, groups, or activities, making effective judgements as to prioritizing and time allocation
Knowledge of approaches, tools, techniques for recognizing, anticipating, and resolving organizational, operational or process problems; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations
Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors
Understanding of customer service, relationship management, and facilitation skills
Solid personal leadership and management skills with a collaborative style
Demonstrate leadership experience and ability to adapt, with willingness to readily take ownership of tasks and problems, which often extend beyond initial scope of responsibility


Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Familiarity and experience with software development processes
Familiarity and experience with project management processes and techniques
Experience with Microsoft Office Tools including MS Project, MS Word, MS PowerPoint and MS Excel
Project Management Certification (e.g. PMP) is an asset
Internship or work experience in corporate setting with demonstrated track record

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

In the digital economy, it takes more than good ideas and strong leadership to thrive. Upgrading outdated processes, systems and information is vital – but can be a risky investment in such a rapidly changing environment. That’s why some of the most prestigious businesses worldwide look to us for authoritative, agile and efficient solutions for business decision-making. As our Solution Architect Manager, you’ll play a leading role in that mission, providing the competitive edge our customers need to overcome some of the biggest creative and technical challenges around.

The opportunity

You’ll be part of a tight-knit team in a growing area of the business. It’s a high-profile role, in which you’ll have plenty of opportunities to showcase your ability to not only coach a team but establish and maintain new customer relationships. As you do, we’ll support you in developing consultancy and analytical skills – along with relationships that could define your career into a Product organization.

Your key responsibilities

Here, you’ll handle a wide portfolio of clients, each with their own backgrounds, strengths and ambitions, so no two days will be the same. That could mean working to improve our clients’ HR, Customer Service, Compliance, Cybersecurity or IT solutions. Wherever you find yourself, you’ll be making a visible impact on projects that cross borders and challenge conventional wisdom to encourage transformation. You’ll often work on-site to personally understand and influence our clients – which could require you to be ready for some travel (not applicable during the global pandemic and only when it is safe to do so).

Skills and attributes for success
Understand future customer, industry and information technology trends and applying this understanding to develop robust solutions and to identify opportunities for future business
Select, tailor and apply formal architectural methods to analyze customer needs and develop requirements for architectural solutions
Evaluate potential solution elements using a formal methodology and select the most appropriate solutions based on business and technical requirements
Assess business and technical impact of solution to understand trade-off and any workaround and technical debt that will be incurred
Acting as a technical leader across all aspects of solutioning including IT roadmap / conceptual architecture, technical due diligence / planning, design and solution delivery
Solid understanding across all architectural domains (business, application, data / information, technology) from conceptual to physical perspectives
Providing trusted advice on how digital transformation and technology enablement can lead to improved performance
Effectively work with other team members to understand customer needs and to design, evaluate and develop architectural solutions which meet those needs
Guide and influence team members, including customer, vendor and subcontractor personnel to accomplish the team's technical and schedule goals
Provide feedback to the team about new or emerging client needs and demonstrate an understanding of EY's key competitive capabilities and value propositions for relevant clients

To qualify for the role, you must have
Seven or more years of experience in a leadership & consultative capacity
Seven or more years of experience managing a full lifecycle solution implementation
Three or more years of experience as a solution architect dealing with both applications and infrastructure considerations
Experience using Zachmann and TOGAF Architecture Frameworks preferred
Familiarity with architectural modeling technique (e.g. UML, ERD, BPMN, etc.)
Experience with different solution delivery / implementation methodologies (i.e. waterfall, RUP, ASCEND, Agile, etc.)
Ability to lead architectural activities including leading all or portions of the project, organizing the team, defining tasks, tracking and reporting progress, delivering on time and within budget, and delivering results to the customer
Ability to develop rapport with others by demonstrating an understanding of their concerns, needs and issues and focus on developing an internal network of relationships that can provide advice and support
Ability to anticipate potential problems associated with the solution being developed by managing the technical risk for the solution to be implemented
Ability to take full responsibility for tasks including consistently reviewing EY team work to identify and improve EY’s approach for producing quality work products
Familiarity with latest technology trends such as cloud, blockchain, DevOps, Analytics, Microservices

Ideally, you’ll also have
A high level of motivation, strong work ethic, and self-starting attitude
Secret clearance preferred

Education
A bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Systems Management, Engineering or similar discipline; supported by experience in a similar technical environment

Experience
Experience in leading a small to medium size team of 6 to 12 cross-functional resources
A customer-focused approach to work, and the ability to translate often-complex requirements into decisive digital platform strategies
The confidence to build lasting relationships and influence senior colleagues and clients from a wide range of backgrounds
A flair for identifying and capitalizing on new revenue streams

What we look for

We’re interested in intellectually curious people, with a genuine passion for finding and implementing innovative ways to nurture growth. You’ll also need excellent communication and negotiation skills, as well as the ability to express big ideas to senior leaders, often without technical backgrounds. If you’re ready to take a leadership role in a team that’s poised to take the industry by storm, this role is for you. You must be willing and able to travel (not applicable during the global pandemic and only when it is safe to do so).

What we offer

At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:
Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.


Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

You are:
A transformation maven with the skills to help clients meet the challenges of digitization. Your superpower? Using your know-how to solve clients’ most complex business problems to help their companies do more. You’re as comfortable working in teams and leading projects as you are diving into the details of workstreams and configuring SAP solutions. And you’re up for traveling regularly to client sites.
The work:
Use your business smarts to kick-start transformation programs, whether domain- or platform-led
Show clients how they can use SAP to solve their business problems
Work in a team where you wear lots of hats – interacting with clients, managing workstreams, collaborating with other teams – and where you may need to be in charge
Run the workstream and/or project activities you’ve been given
Interact with all workstreams – technical, reports, conversion, change management, project management and more
Tweak current methods, tools and procedures to create solutions that meet clients’ needs
Check business requirements to find configuration solutions
Keep a record of requirements, solutions and impacts, alternatives and final decisions
Here’s what you need:
Minimum 4 years of SAP transformation, technical advisory or consulting experience, or 8 years of equivalent industry experience
Minimum 3 years of experience across multiple integration platform tools - PI/PO, CPI, HCI, Dell Boomi, MuleSoft
Minimum 1 year of experience as a Project, Large Workstream, or Client Lead on a large SAP transformational project with on- and off-shore resources
A Bachelor’s Degree

Here’s what you need:
Minimum 4 years of SAP transformation, technical advisory or consulting experience, or 8 years of equivalent industry experience
Minimum 3 years of experience across multiple integration platform tools - PI/PO, CPI, HCI, Dell Boomi, MuleSoft
Minimum 1 year of experience as a Project, Large Workstream, or Client Lead on a large SAP transformational project with on- and off-shore resources
A Bachelor’s Degree
Bonus points if:
You have expertise in Data Center migrations specific to integration platforms migration (to support Azure cloud migration)
Solid functional knowledge leveraging integration solutions across various business applications & scenarios - Ariba, SAP SF, Salesforce etc.
You know how SAP’s business development process works and you can help clients understand how SAP will help their company do more

The Enterprise Architect supports the Manager in overall enterprise technology initiatives, by
serving as the organization’s expert in enterprise IT architecture. Key responsibilities are planning
and designing the ITS capabilities to meet desired organizational objectives. Activities include
cataloging, developing, coordinating, communicating, maintaining, and enforcing overall
enterprise architecture models, representations, initiatives, capabilities, and components to
perform the organization's business and technology activities. The position will provide the final
review of architecture documentation and provide guidance to other ITS teams to ensure all
projects and changes are in adherence to architectural principles and adhere to the overall
enterprise architecture vision and design. As a part of this role, the individual will also be a subject
matter expert to enable the integration of business, data, and technologies.

DUTIES:
Under the general direction of the designated supervisor, and working within a team structure, this
position is responsible for enterprise architecture design, planning and compliance.

Design:

The duties include the final review of documents and providing technical expertise in architecture
design, including the following:
Analyses, defines, evaluates and provides final review of enterprise architecture
requirements across the various architecture domains for large scale/enterprise wide IT
systems in order to optimize effectiveness
Participates in/conducts feasibility studies, architecture reviews of new IT systems or
modification / redevelopment of legacy systems;
Facilitates and seamlessly integrates business strategy and service strategy into the
enterprise architecture roadmap by partnering with both the business and other ITS teams
in the areas of:
o Business architecture design, including co-ordination of business processes and
collecting business requirements/ objectives, incorporating geographic, functional,
and organizational targets;
o Information system architecture, including designing the integration of data and
applications across the enterprise in alignment with the business architecture; and
o Technology architecture, including designing the integration of technology systems
and middleware;
Provides subject matter expertise for the integration of solution components in ITS
architecture domains, including the final review and technical decision-making on the
complete integration of complex systems;
Promotes the use of a shared infrastructure and application roadmap to reduce costs and
improve how information flows;
Provides facilitation and stewardship across the spectrum of enterprise architecture across
all of the architecture domains;
Partners with business and technology subject-matter experts to elicit and translate
business requirements into technological solutions;
Establishes guidelines and strategies for the selection of solution architecture components,
and co-ordinates design activities
Creates and documents architecture artifacts;
Manages and facilitates evaluation of project proposals for architectural fit, collaborate with
other team members to achieve project milestones and evaluate IT solutions against the
organization’s IT needs;
Provides expert technical support for the integration of systems for both sustainment and
projects.
Planning:
The duties include the final review of documents and providing technical expertise in ITS planning,
including the following:
Works closely with business and technology teams to connect strategic goals to business
outcomes
Builds the long-term strategic roadmap for all IT systems architecture;
Aligns IT strategy and planning with the company’s business goals and objectives;
Creates and communicates architecture strategies capabilities and plans, including future
states and roadmaps, to all partners including the business, delivery teams, and ITS
Management;
Researches and understands industry trends and their applicability to support architectural
plans and strategies for the enterprise;
Completes impact and risk assessments and presents results to influence strategic
investment decisions;
Leads the analysis of the business’ s future state capabilities, operating models and future
ITS ecosystems to detect critical deficiencies; makes strategic recommendations to business
and ITS leaders to rationalize business and technical services
Leads a cross functional team of subject matter experts in the development of enterprise
architecture/architectural blueprints, enterprise reference architectures, and technology
roadmaps that will be leveraged in an integrated fashion;
Leads the analysis, development and evaluation of new directions and options for
architecture, in order to recommend policy and standards which are consistent with diverse
corporate and client needs, strategies, directions and resources.
Compliance:
The duties include the final review of documents and providing technical expertise for the
compliance of architecture processes., including the following:
Consults with ITS leaders to ensure consistency and alignment with the enterprise
architecture, as well as to identify when it is necessary to modify the enterprise
architecture;
Develops and maintains policies, standards, and guidelines to ensure that a consistent
framework is applied across the organization;
Conducts final review of and documents the architecture artifacts for legacy systems
through facilitation with key stakeholder groups;
Educates participants to the enterprise architecture processes and continuously improves
the program.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Post-secondary degree in Computer Science
Enterprise architect certification (TOGAF or Zachman) is preferred, or demonstrated
equivalency through experience
Expert technical knowledge and experience in the following areas:
o Technical certifications in relevant technology stacks (e.g. AWS, GCP, Azure, IBM)
o Experience designing, integrating, and managing complex infrastructure solutions
(e.g. Cloud computing, HyperV, VMware, Citrix, middleware)
o Comprehensive knowledge of hardware, software, application, and systems
engineering
o Integration of complex and disparate systems
Five (5) years of business experience in strategic and operations planning and/or business
analysis
Ten (10) years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training,
and experience in an enterprise architect role, including the development of architecture
roadmaps, project architecture, and program sustainment. This includes business,
information, solution or technical architecture, application development, middleware,
information analysis, database management or operations in a multitier environment
Ability to establish, implement, and enforce appropriate IT standards to meet business
requirements
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with experience leading discussions,
communicating technology paradigm shifts to business and technical staff, developing and
fostering teamwork and facilitating team dynamics
Demonstrated strength in documentation and attention to detail
Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment with the ability to
collaboratively lead technical teams through the architectural processes
A proven track record of leadership and high-level skills in managing and sustaining
projects
SALARY: $97,916.00 per annum (2022 Rate)

HOW TO APPLY:
E-mail your cover letter and resume, quoting the Job Posting #, to recruitment@tpl.ca. We thank all
applicants and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

COVID-19 vaccines are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical or
other protected ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.

The Toronto Public Library invites applications from all qualified individuals. The Library is
committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from
visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual
orientation or gender identity.

Upon request, accommodation will be provided for persons with disabilities through all stages of
the recruitment and selection process.

Architect multi account environments for different teams such as production, development, Management, etc.
Migrate legacy applications to AWS cloud environment.
Meet with stake holders and technical teams for requirements gathering prior to migration.
Build different infrastructures as code using Terraform
Leverage CloudFormation to automate the build of AWS resources.
Create VPCs with different CIDRS and subnet while securing using NACLS and Security Groups.
Develop baseline AWS account security, implemented/integrated end-point protection, vulnerability scanning and intelligent threat detection.
Build serverless architecture with Lambda integrated with SNS, CloudWatch logs and other AWS services.
Leverage automated DevOps tools deployment and Blue-green deployment patterns and strategies.
Configure CI/CD Pipelines using Jenkins integrated with Ansible and connected to GitHub to automate the code build process.
Implement IAM best practices and role-based access control.
Implement AWS Organization to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts including consolidated billing, centralized monitoring, and policy-based restrictions.
Implement a Multi-Tenant architecture using Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Services (EKS).
Migrate On-Premises Infrastructure to AWS Cloud.
Configure and manage various AWS Services including EC2, RDS, VPC, S3, Glacier, Cloud Watch, Cloud Front, and Route 53 etc.

Write various Lambda services for automating the functionality on the Cloud.

Involve in setting up builds using Chef as a configuration management tool.
Create AMIs for mission critical production servers for backup.
Work in all areas of Jenkins setting up CI for new branches, build automation, plugin management and securing Jenkins and setting up master/slave configurations.
Deploy application updates using Jenkins. Installed, configured, and managed Jenkins.
Built applications of various architecture styles like Micro-services.
Deploy and configured Git repositories with branching, forks, tagging, and notifications.
Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Summary: In this role, the Cloud Architect works as a consultant for Onix clients to be a subject matter expert on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.) guiding them through technical solutions that solve their business needs. The cloud architect provides the thought-leadership for the client and then translates that to actionable steps for cloud engineers to implement. This role is both architect and analyst but specific to cloud technology.
*
Primary Responsibilities:
Deliver cloud architecture projects for Onix clients.
Deliver high-level architecture design documents for customer engagements.
Develop detailed-level design requirements for architecture implementations.
Work with clients to understand and develop their target cloud architecture needs.
Assess an organization’s current architecture and readiness for implementing cloud technologies.
Work internally to develop delivery guides, assessments, and common architecture patterns for cloud architecture projects.
Work with cloud engineers and developers on engagements to deliver end-to-end solutions for clients.
Deliver projects around cloud security, governance, and other foundational aspects of cloud computing.
*
*
Preferred Skills and Experience:
Work closely with project managers and solution architects to ensure applications are delivered accurately and within timeline & budget.
Certification as an AWS Solutions Architect, Cloud Security Certification, and/or Google Cloud Engineer Certification a plus. (Other cloud-related certifications are also a plus.)
Five years’ of experience in developing software using languages such as Java, Python, C++, Go, or Ruby.
Experience with micro-service applications and cloud-based services.
Experience working with AWS and GCP.
Experience with CI/CD and automated delivery systems.
Three to five years’ experience in a Cloud Engineer role or related position.
Three to five years’ experience implementing foundational cloud services (networking, security, account/organizations, logging & monitoring, identity access management, etc.)
Experience implementing cloud controls, security, and audit services
Experience with cloud compute, storage, and other IaaS services
Experience in large-scale migration of application workloads from on-prem or collocated data centers to a cloud platform
Demonstrated experience implementing cloud platform services to achieve business solutions.
Experience with cloud platform serverless frameworks
Experience implementing infrastructure as code using cloud formation and/or Terraform
Experience managing Docker/Kubernetes workloads
Experience with Apigee and API Gateway Management
Canadian Government Secret Security Clearance required
*
*
Education: Bachelor's Degree preferred but not required.
*

Yes
