Our people make all the difference in our success.
Sales Solution Architect

Overview of Position

The Sales Solution Architect acts as the pre-sales technical specialists
for the Sales representative assigned to install base customers and/or
prospects. This role will work directly with customers and Sales
Personnel to perform requirements analysis of potential/existing system
environments, to prepare detailed configurations and their attendant
quotations, and to present the Change Healthcare solution in a way that is
meaningful to the customer. This role is ideal for candidates who enjoy solution design and are achievement-oriented. The ideal candidate is success-driven, fast-paced, and works well in a team and enjoys a dynamic and changing environment.

What will be my duties and responsibilities in this job?
Prepare and present detailed quotes and system configurations, occasionally with a higher complexity
Ensure solution/product/component technically meets customer’s needs
Respond to product inquiries from customers
Present Change Healthcare’s image management and enterprise workflow solutions to customers including near-term product futures
Describe quotation/solution in terms easily understood by all levels of organization
Discuss high level benefits of all products/components presented in solution/quote and be able to discuss alternative solutions (custom or future development)
Serve as the "point person" for technical questions from the Sales Representatives and customers.
Provide guidance to the Sales Representative and consult with customer on solution.
Coordinate collaboration with cross-functional teams, to ensure overall pre-sales project deliverables
Work closely with the Sales Contracts team
Participate in lead generation and targeted campaigns
What are the requirements needed for this position?
5+ years experience with large healthcare facilities on radiology and/or cardiology products including strong technical knowledge of the products.
Prefer 3-5 years of successful medical imaging(Radiology and/or Cardiology) sales related experience to hospitals.
Extensive knowledge of Enterprise IT infrastructure, including networks, server and workstation hardware components and software applications.

What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?
Extensive knowledge of Enterprise IT infrastructure, including networks, server and workstation hardware components and software applications
High level customer service skills; excellent communication skills
Leadership, organizational and time management abilities
Ability to learn quickly and drive change in a fast-paced, challenging environment.
Highly motivated individual with proven ability to successfully manage customer relationships
Ability to translate technical understanding to action plans and issue resolution
Strong negotiation, conflict management & customer service skills
Knowledge of current information systems technology and of healthcare industry and trends
Self starter with exceptional commitment to providing superior proactive customer service
Effectively communicate to customers in both written and verbal forms, including the ability to convey difficult/sensitive information tactfully
Ability to work proactively and independently within a fast paced environment and under pressure
Strong understanding of our diagnostic imaging and workflow solutions including architecture design and requirements.
Strong understanding of hardware platforms, cloud architecture and virtualization
Solid understanding of how our products fit into customers sites from both a clinical and IT perspective
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, industrial engineering, or related field preferred or equivalent work experience

What are the working conditions and physical requirements of this job?

General office demands

How much should I expect to travel?

10%-15%

column2: 2023 Bell Business Markets Grad Leadership Program - Special...
column7:
Req Id: 391271

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content - we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.

If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

Our Bell Business Markets team enables the digital transformation of businesses and governments nationwide through solutions in areas including Internet and private networks, voice and unified communications, contact centre, security, Internet of Things, data centre and cloud. We’re proud to be Canada’s leading provider of broadband network and communication services for businesses and governments.

As a new grad, you will drive B2B solutions, develop business opportunities, further product roadmaps, collaborate across the business, and learn from industry experts. Leverage the country’s largest voice, data, and wireless network, and leading end-to-end solutions, to support the aspirations of Canadian businesses. This unique and accelerated program will not only give you extensive knowledge and experience working on complex business issues, it will also enable you to develop your leadership skills.

Upon completion of the program, you will have the knowledge, skills, network, and breadth of experience to help transform the organization and become the next generation of leaders at Bell.

Why join us?
Benefit from a continuous learning environment and develop your expertise in your role.
Get to know the BBM family and its executive team during an orientation session.
Deliver on transformational projects to launch new product roadmaps, services, and solutions, to enable the customer to do more.
Expand your network as you work with the industry experts, including our amazing peer-to-peer grad and alumni support network.
Develop your technical and leadership skills through formal and experiential training programs.
Grow through one-to-one mentorship with experienced leaders, and career coaching from our leadership development team.
Transition easily from the university life you love; be part of a vibrant community of grads and never stop learning!

In this role, you will…
As part of the Pre-Sales business development process, you will be part of the team involved in designing future technological architectures for Enterprise customers and supporting important programs defined by customers in their medium/long-term strategies. The incumbent's primary responsibility will be to ensure team success by delivering quality results on time and in particular for simple customer requests affecting the proposed solutions.

Role & Responsibilities:
Establish trusted advisor relationship with senior architects and Bell internal contributors (sales, Pre-Sales, delivery, etc.)
Act as a reference for architects regarding internal processes related to Pre-Sales activities such as WAN links validation, technical documents provisioning, change requests, etc
Have a good knowledge of different processes in order to optimize Pre-Sales requests and transmit to the team all new changes and improvements
Work as a team with all contributors to be efficient in Pre-Sales tasks
Support senior architects in preparing solutions presentation material based on customer needs
Determine technical risks related to processes or delay and suggest mitigation options
Coordinate with Sales and internal teams to pursue sales cycles
Preferred Competencies: Bachelor’s degree Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
You should apply if:
You have a Bachelor’s degree or Graduate completed before the program start date and no earlier than two years before your application date.
You are excited about telecommunications and have demonstrated curiosity, initiative, leadership and a passion for learning new skills.
You are interested in driving organizational change and taking on new challenges.
You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written)
You have the ability to lead and influence others

Application Instructions:
Apply on Bell careers page.
You must submit a resume, and most recent transcripts (unofficial accepted) to be considered.
Focus your efforts and apply to a maximum of 3 Bell postings that match your skills and interests.

If you are looking to deliver leading edge business application solutions and are an experienced Power Platform Functional or Technical expert, we are looking for you! As a Dynamics 365 Power Platform Senior Consultant you will work with Industry focused teams to deliver world class Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement and Operation solutions, leveraging Microsoft Power Platform technologies. You will build model-driven, canvas, and portal apps, create Power Automate flows, design chatbots using Power Virtual Agents, and analyze data using Power BI visualization and dashboards.
Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. Growth mindset encourages each of us to lean in and learn what matters most to our customers, to create the foundational knowledge that enables us to make customer-first decisions in everything we do. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us achieve our mission.
Microsoft’s Business Applications Domain helps customers maximize their investment in Microsoft Dynamics 365 solutions, the full portfolio of Microsoft Products and Microsoft Azure through accelerated adoption and productive use of technologies. The Microsoft Business Applications Domain team is part of a worldwide organization of exceptional people who lead and serve our customers to realize their full potential through software and services.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Pre-Sales Support
Collaborates with internal stakeholders (e.g., Solution Architect, Account Delivery Executive, Pursuit Lead, Sales Solution Specialist) in the pre-sale process by understanding business requirements and providing industry and technical input and/or solution offerings to help shape the deal. Supports drafting proposals and/or statement of work (SOW).
Provides input on staffing and skill requirements for delivery to Resource Deployment, Technical Delivery Managers (TDMs), and/or Project Managers.

Technical Delivery
Follows capacity process outlined by Global Capacity Management (GCM) team. Maintains tools with up-to-date skills and availability.
Leads meetings with customers/partners to understand business needs. Uses business, industry, and technology strategies to map customer/partner requirements to the adoption and optimization of Microsoft technology solutions. Engages others appropriately to understand and define customer requirements
Participates in project planning and develops project documents by identifying the risks and dependencies. Communicates the business value of planned solutions to customers/ partners. Identifies technical and business risks in programs and proposes mitigations. Assists project managers/architects in preparing for steering committee (e.g., developing artifacts). Manages their schedule and communicates to project leads. Generates and delivers Work Breakdown Structure (WBS).
Implements solutions and provides oversight and leadership on workstreams across domains while adhering to Microsoft Services processes. Aligns solutions with the intent of the architecture.
Manages escalations, analyzes situations, and coordinates appropriate resources to resolve issues by following delivery practices, considering cost implications, and engaging in conversations with internal and external stakeholders (e.g., Customer Service and Support, Project Manager, Solution Architect, Product Group) as needed.
Proactively manages executive-level customer/partner/stakeholder relationships to identify and contribute to the drivers of satisfaction and dissatisfaction, determine the root cause, and establish recovery actions to improve the experience. Works with account team to ensure One Microsoft approach. Shares lessons learned with workgroup and consultant community.

Intellectual Property Management
Acts as an ambassador in the consumption of intellectual property (IP) by leveraging and/or modifying existing IP or creating repeatable content where applicable. Provides feedback on Managed IP for continuous improvement, reports IP gaps, reviews IP to be considered for harvesting and curation and ensures it is logged for consumption. Improves Managed Standard Offerings (MSO) quality and collaborates with portfolio and solution teams of the domain by providing feedback.

Business Development
Identifies opportunities to expand or accelerate the adoption and consumption of the cloud and Microsoft technologies. Facilitates, as appropriate, other team members to scale the business with existing customers by articulating value propositions of strategic Microsoft products and services and developing new offerings for the domain. Drives innovation and digital transformation. Ensures the use of the existing intellectual property (IP).

Readiness
Learns new technologies or services based on business demands and industry trends. Obtains relevant accreditations and certification(s) as advised by domain leadership team. Identifies certifications and readiness plans in partnership with domain Chief Technology Officer (CTO). Leads or participates in relevant technical communities, and conducts training sessions to evangelize technology and/or offerings based on availability. Mentors team members and acts as a technical advisor for stakeholders by providing thought leadership, articulation of solutions value, and outcomes of business strategies.
Operational Excellence
Completes operational tasks and readiness, and ensures timeliness and accuracy. Follows Microsoft policies, compliance, and procedures (e.g., Enterprise Services Authorization Policy, Standards of Business Conduct, labor logging, expenses, travel guidelines). Leads as example and guides team members on operational tasks, readiness, and compliance.

Maintain Industry Knowledge
Our goal within Industry Solutions is to provide an experience for our customers that demonstrates our Industry expertise from Sales through Delivery. Our Project Managers are required to maintain Industry knowledge in areas such as Retail, Manufacturing, Healthcare, Financial Services & Insurance, State & Local Government, and Education to name a few. You will be fully accountable to maintaining an Industry expertise aligned with Industry Solutions’ strategic direction.

Qualifications
Qualifications
Required/Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, Business, or related field AND 3+ years consulting leadership experience in relevant area of business
OR equivalent experience.
It is a requirement of this position that you would currently have, or have the ability to obtain Reliability Status screening from a duly authorized department or agency of the Government of Canada.
This process includes but is not limited to verification of identity, background, education, professional credentials, personal and professional references, credit check and criminal background check. Reliability Status screening may also require a security questionnaire and security interview. To obtain the requisite clearance within required timelines, applicants must have five (5) years of continuous Canadian residency, and must not have lived or worked outside of Canada for more than six (6) months during that time, unless Microsoft is satisfied that the requisite clearance can nevertheless be obtained within required timelines.
For more information on this process, visit the following web page:Government of Canada - Reliability Status
Additional or Preferred Qualifications

Technical Certifications (e.g., Customer Engagement, Azure, Security, Power Platform).
Delivery Management Certifications (e.g., Scrum, Agile, Change Management, Project Management).

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

#ISDelivery

We are Industry X:
We embed innovation, intelligence and sustainability in the way the world makes things and the things it makes. Industry X enables leaders to act quickly and confidently as they pivot to the future. We define Industry X as digital reinvention of manufacturing / engineering and believe that smart, sustainable, connected digital products and assets are about to create hyper-personalized industrial experiences, completely new levels of operational efficiency, transparency and traceability, tangible impact on sustainability and brand-new sources of revenue growth. Known for our ability to execute at speed, we help clients determine clear, actionable paths to competitive agility by bringing them new thinking on business and technology. Visit us at Industry X Careers
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology, and Operations services, all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 674,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
You Are:
A digital expert with in-depth knowledge of the AVEVA PI System, who tirelessly advocates for the use of Operational Technology (OT) data to drive improvements in process performance, equipment integrity, safety, and regulatory compliance. You’re not afraid to question the status quo, and you’ve guided operations and engineering organizations through change to make the most of new digital tools. There’s a depth and breadth to your knowledge of Operational Technology systems, especially AVEVA PI, — and you’re generous about sharing that wisdom with colleagues. Communication and people skills? Yours are a cut above, which is why you’re so good at building and managing a team-centric environment. And when it comes to problem-solving, your creative and analytical abilities shift into high gear.
The Work:
Lead the end-to-end technical implementation of complex, global and large-scale AVEVA PI solutions in a highly client facing role
Advise clients on technology strategy, operating models, business cases and road mapping
Co-create with engineering and operations leadership to define high-value solutions
Create and communicate technical best practices and standards
Combine an understanding of the business and tech side of industrial software with your working knowledge of development methodologies like Agile and Waterfall
Build and lead high performing teams of functional and technical practitioners to tackle complex challenges
For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only.

Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts.

Basic Qualifications:
Minimum of 5 years implementing historian systems . Preferred: OSIsoft PI, AspenTech InfoPlus21.
Deep understanding of historian architecture and integration, including PI Asset Framework
Minimum 5 years working in Oil and Gas, Chemicals, Manufacturing, Life Sciences or other industrial environments
Bachelor’s Degree in related engineering or technical field
English is required for this position as this role will be aligned to multi-national teams where English is the common language across our North America Market. Due to the significant high volume of interactions with these English-speaking multi-national teams, which is inherent to this position, it is not possible to reorganize the company's activities to avoid this requirement.
Bonus points if:
Experience in a consulting environment with demonstrated track record of continuing responsibilities, creativity and innovation
Ability to work in teams with diverse/ multiple stakeholder environment
Exceptionally strong leadership & communication skills to effectively manage client accounts and multidisciplinary teams
MES Automation & Controls experience
Enterprise Asset Management

Platform & Cloud Architect
Hybrid - Toronto, ON
Platform and Cloud Architect will be responsible for development and delivery of comprehensive technical solutions and supporting Platform and Cloud required in a variety of business and technical domains.
Who are you?
12+ years relevant experience
Technical authority and subject matter expertise in relevant areas
Having comprehensive experience in leading edge technologies within functional and cross functional disciplines
Capable of performing investigations and evaluation of new technologies, can forecast the necessity and visibility of modifying organization’s technology strategy. Capable of building strategic and tactical roadmaps.
Have capabilities to influences senior management in setting the organization’s technical objectives though a rational approach
Have a broad and comprehensive understanding of the different systems, theories and practices relevant to a job discipline
Possess highly specialized skills to expand Interac’s technology footprint and to increase operational efficiencies in support of Interac’s business objectives
Have a comprehensive knowledge of the industry in order to contribute to the commercial objectives of the business.
Can lead cross-segment / functional project teams of initiatives. Acts as a mentor and role model to others within the organization.
Exercise a high degree of autonomy when making decisions that impact segment or function deliverables. Identifies strategic issues that need to be addressed and convenes appropriate parties to select the optimal path.

Job Description:

Project Architect
Skyhook Modular Architects
50 Goodrich Dr, Kitchener ON N2C 2L3

Skyhook is an OAA-licensed practice dedicated to advanced modular mid-rise residential design and construction.
We oversee the development of residential product lines and custom software to deploy these principles.
This strategy allows residential buildings to be factory-produced and stacked in different shapes, heights, and styles.
This streamlined design process allow housing to be built faster and cheaper than traditional methods.

Our primary client is Z Modular Canada who is both the Developer and Manufacturer.
Z Modular (z-modular.com) is a fast-growing design-build modular company with plants in Kitchener and the US.
Their patented modular system allows Developers and Architects to build faster and more-efficiently than ever before.

An immediate full-time position is available for a Project Architect with experience in the design and management of several residential projects, from Schematic Design to Project Close-out.
The ideal candidate will have an interest in modular construction, automated fabrication systems, parametric design software, and developing alternative approaches to the construction industry.

REQUIRED SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES:
Experience ~8 years post-grad in Architect office, and experience as a Project Architect
Degree Arch/M.Arch
Registration OAA license is required
Project mgmt Knowledge of CHOP work schedules and project budgets
Team mgmt Skill in managing the design team and stakeholders
Contract mgmt Knowledge of Design-build and sub-consultant contracts
Construction mgmt Knowledge of CCDC contracts, management and administration
Communications Liaison with Design team, Clients, Contractors and Fabricators
Code In-depth understanding of OBC and other regulatory documents
BIM Advanced understanding of Revit and BIM360, Dynamo is an asset
Building Science Advanced experience in construction drawings, shop drawings & details
Office Leadership Assist in various office operations and HR

Duties & Responsibilities:
Project Architect: Design using modular standards to design buildings
Meetings weekly meeting for projects, coordination and production
PM generate project schedule and budget, and administer the design team
Details develop of new modular details for current projects and the product line
Code review code for envelope, fire separations, accessibility, etc
Coordinate coordinate design details and clash detection with design team
Deliverable oversee drawing package for Permit and Tender
Cloud assist in management of Sharepoint, Procore and BIM360
Office Leadership R&D: Assist in developing generative design and robotics
Office assist with office operating procedures
Sales assist with sales, outreach and presentations
Production assist in scheduling weekly production needs
Staffing assist in resourcing and delegate tasks to design team
HR assist in the review and interview of potential employees
Training assist in onboarding training and mentoring for new designers and PMs
Travel potential travel in CAN/US to meet clients or visit other plants

Regular, full-time, predictable onsite attendance per the posted schedule is an essential function of this role
Lead and promote health and safety work practices as required by regulatory agencies and company policy

Skyhook Modular, a joint venture of Z-Modular

We seek to continuously advance the skills and opportunities of our employees, utilizing the latest technology and management tools available to consistently increase profitability and the enterprise value.

Skyhook is an Equal Opportunity Employer compliant with all Ontario law & Human Rights Code in providing accommodation to persons with disabilities and to ensuring an accessible environment. We will accommodate persons with disabilities during the recruitment and assessment processes and persons with disabilities will be accommodated on hiring and during employment. Location: Toronto, ON, CA Victoria, British Columbia, CA Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Burnaby, British Columbia, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Calgary, AB, CA Scarborough, ON, CA Ottawa, ON, CA
Req ID: 30026
Jobs by Category: Technology Solutions
Job Function: Engineering & Development
Status: Full Time
Schedule: Regular
Join our team and what we'll accomplish together

You’ll be joining a dynamic and highly-skilled architecture team. We deliver working solutions to enable best-in-class business and systems capabilities, guided by our customers’ needs and strategic priorities.

Our daily actions are guided by 3 tenets that are critical for our success:

ArchDevOps: We are Closing the gap between strategy and execution by embedding agile architectural practices into the DevOps lifecycle, easy flow and real-time in-the-moment review

Product-centric mindset: We focus on what our customers need with clearly defined, outcome-based, deliverables and we execute using a build-measure-learn loop model

Agile mindset: We apply agile architecture principles in everything we do


What you'll do

We are looking for a dynamic technical enthusiast who has lived both the developer and software designer experience. You can code as well as you can whiteboard and understand how to bring together both perspectives to create true collaboration. Together we will make whatever changes necessary to processes and tools to achieve this end. With a strong mandate and support from our senior leadership team, you have the power to transform how we work together, from concept to production. All of the tools and processes in that lifecycle are fair game. If you believe that it can be better, we will make it so together.

As an Architect Advocate, you are accountable for building bridges between the designers and builders and for encouraging a wider community of practice that listens to all stakeholders.

Relying on continuous feedback, you will foster agile and adaptive design and engineering practices.

Here’s how
Collaborate with Architecture and DevOps teams
Work with and listen to developers and software architects to understand their experience and what is currently hindering their collaboration, focus, flow, and joy.
Evangelize Agile Architecture practices, and drive process or tool changes to make it happen by collaborating with their owners and customers.
Design and write code, config, and scripts to improve the design and development lifecycle and integrate systems.
Champion use of solid architecture practices and alignment to portfolio strategy
Mature and scale the Architecture practice
Guide, develop and inspire Architecture and DevOps team members
Facilitate Architecture Guilds and other architecture groups, to learn, share knowledge, and enhance the sense of collaboration through continuous feedback
What you bring

Strong background and experience in Software Architecture, Software and System Design and Implementation using Agile Architecture and Agile Development practices in an enterprise space
Experience using CI/CD best practices with tools such as GitHub Actions, GCP Cloud Build, Spinnaker, Jenkins
Experience in API and microservices design & development preferably using NodeJS, Java, Python. Hands on with Postman, GraphQL
Experience with event driven architecture and knowledge of PubSub technologies such as Kafka and/or Google PubSub
You have experience with cloud-native technologies, such as Docker, Kubernetes, and Terraform and have used cloud platforms for application hosting
Known for your collaborative approach and ability to build and maintain strong partnerships with stakeholders including executive leaders
Strong architectural skills modularizing components in large applications
Regarded as an exceptional communicator (clear and concise), influencer and negotiator, including an ability to articulate complex technical details in a business context and drive alignment through compelling storytelling and presentation to executive audiences
Strong self-management, initiative, and skill in leading without direct authority.
Great-to-haves
Experience working in Telecommunications industry
Google Cloud Architect, Cloud Developer, Cloud DevOps Engineer, and/or Data Engineer Certifications

Ceridian is a global leader in Human Capital Management technology. Experience working for one of the fastest growing Human Capital Management technology companies in the world Access to Ceridian’s development programs and resources

Roles Available:
Test Engineer Intern – Talent Intelligence Team (1 role)

Participate in the creation and execution of test plans and test cases

Identify and escalate issues related to plan and quality
Improve and implement automation framework code to expand automated test coverage

In progress College or University degree course in Computer Science or related field
Smart and driven individual who is passionate about learning new technologies and building high quality cloud applications
Strong academic performance in courses regarding programming languages, algorithms and data structures, computer organization, and discrete mathematics.
Disciplined self-starter, capable of working independently or in close collaboration within an agile development team
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Experience with manual or automated testing of Android and iOS applications
Strong coding skills in a modern object-oriented language (e.g., C#, Java, C++)
Working knowledge of modern web technologies including: JavaScript, HTML, CSS 3, SVG, JSON, etc. from professional or academic projects
Good understanding of software development principles and basic knowledge of writing code with use of OOP concepts
Working knowledge of modern relational databases architecture and SQL language through professional or academic projects
Understanding of Software Development Life Cycle and relevant quality assurance concepts
Passion for solving hard problems and knows how to have fun!
Nice to have:
Strong understanding of programming knowledge and concepts with a front-end focus
Experience with modern JavaScript libraries such as Dojo, React, Angular, Ember, Backbone, etc.
Experience working with SaaS Enterprise Software
Experience with automated performance testing
Experience working with enterprise cloud application
Experience with .NET framework
Experience working with C#
Experience working any of the following testing tools: Selenium, FitNesse, SpecFlow, Jenkins, JMeter, Cucumber, TestNG, Espresso, XCUITest or RESTful API services
Experience with Content Management Systems (CMS) an asset. E.g. Umbraco, Orchard, Kentico, Joomla, Drupal, etc.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION:

SuccessFactors, an SAP company is the global leader in Business Execution Software. Our integrated suite of cloud-based applications is relied upon by many customers in over 168 countries to bridge the gap between business strategy and business results with improved execution. SuccessFactors’ solutions improve execution by optimizing people performance in three key areas:
Aligning the workforce with the business strategy
Attracting and retaining top talent
Developing that talent to meet the current business challenge
We also deliver a comprehensive view of the workforce through robust analytics, planning and core HR applications. SuccessFactors solutions help companies execute faster and smarter, with greater insight – delivering better business results than ever before.

SuccessFactors has a unique culture. We are highly innovative and our products are defining new frontiers of software-as-a-service. We have extraordinary leadership and are passionately focused on revolutionizing the future of work. We invite you to be part of this wonderful company. Successfactors is seeking an experienced senior-level Integrations Consultant to work as a Lead Integrations Consultant in the Integrations practice within our Cloud Integrations and Extensions services.

Use Enterprise integration/application tools to design, develop, troubleshoot, debug and deploy integrations/applications for customers

Keep the customer satisfaction levels high by providing timely services to customers
Work with global teams regularly and handle multiple projects/technical tasks at any point of time

Bachelors/Master’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering

Strong English communication skills

Title: Senior Architect

The Team
Scotiabank is embarking on a major initiative to modernize end to end Payments technology and processes, and we need a Senior Architect to help us on this journey. You will be joining our team of hands-on payments architects to design and build the bank’s next generation of payment systems which serve all our commercial and retail business lines across the globe.

The Role
We are looking for a Senior Architect to help drive out global payments solutions for the enterprise.
Some of the key accountabilities include:
Design end to end payment solutions, working closely with engineering teams, product owners, security architects, and enterprise architects
Socialize our solutions with the rest of the bank, creating security design documents, technical design documents, and material for enterprise architecture review boards

Experience as a solutions architect, application architect, or tech lead in large complex projects
Tech expertise in enterprise integration (APIs, asynchronous messaging), security architecture, databases, cloud infrastructure, on-prem infrastructure
Great communication and presentation skills – the ability to lead engineers, grow talent, and tell our story to the rest of the bank

o Payments domain knowledge – industry messaging formats such as ISO20022, SWIFT MX/MT, CPA005, NACHA, etc

We pride ourselves on translating our clients’ challenges into real results by leveraging technology – and that all starts with having the right people to deliver. We’ve created an environment where you’ll continuously grow, always have a voice and collaborate on work that’s meaningful and fulfilling. Work with enterprise software developers and architects on Microsoft D365 & Power Platform
Use your extensive product knowledge to define and present effective Microsoft D365 solutions
Engage directly with clients to understand their business and explain how MNP can help
Collaborate with clients and project team to identify client needs through interviews, workshops and requirements analysis, define a solution to meet those needs and implement a working, timely solution
Participate to SCRUM sessions and contribute to estimation of work
Understand, diagnose, and recommend solutions for specific functional and technical challenges
Design and develop D365 Business Solutions
Define, discuss, and document solution, application and data architectures

We are looking for a Solution Architect

Given the size and scope of our organization, we have the flexibility for this position to be located in the following head office locations: Toronto, London, Winnipeg.

Are you passionate about information security in technology and business? Do you continuously evaluate information security risks in what you do? Do you apply risks reductions in your architectures and designs? Do you think there is no mountain too high and ocean too deep? If you answered a wholehearted yes to all these questions, we might have a great opportunity for you.

Reporting to the AVP Security Technology, you will be a key contributor to the evolution of how we will meet the Security service requirements of the teams we support. Senior System Architect is an expert in the product or platform team accountable for the overall solution design quality and persistency of alignment. This role defines and maintains the solution architecture and detailed solution design and ensures the as-built state is in alignment with the design and meets the operational requirements. The individual ensures solution architectures and designs are in alignment with enterprise and portfolio architecture directions and organizational standards.

The architect leads any design documentation, continuous improvement of design and seeks guidance from Portfolio Architectures and Engineering and Operations on architecturally significant decisions. The system architect may be called upon to help resolve production problems. Depending on the solution design needs of the Product, the Solutions Architect may or may not be dedicated to a Product Team or be shared amongst multiple Product Teams.

What you will do
Accountable for design and technical quality of the security solution measured by demonstrated attainment of service levels and number of incidents
Develops and maintains the security solution architecture as well as contribute security architecture inputs in other systems architecture and detailed solution design views for one or more products
Accountable for soliciting and documenting the operational requirements and obtaining sign-off from the Product Owner/Sponsor
Ensures system usability is considered, both from a human factors point of view and as it impacts system engineering
Fine tunes models and designs to account for technical realities that are revealed during implementation
Participates in design and code walkthroughs
Supports the transition to production
Helps resolve operational issues (incidents and problems)
Ensures the implemented product/solution meets the operational requirements and is in alignment with enterprise and portfolio architecture directions, and the organization’s policies and standards, or proposes and obtains variance
Escalates architecturally significant decisions to the Portfolio Architecture
Works closely with other members of the product/project team to ensure a balanced solution considering all perspectives
Provides input to the creation of the project management deliverables, including project charter, risk assessment, project schedule, and work breakdown statement
Remains informed about all significant technical aspects, activities and associated business and technical impacts
Work with LOB and Architecture leads to balance need for purity with delivery pressures
Leads prototyping activities
Contributes to the development and selection of systems architecture practices, tools, techniques, and standards
Proactively identify and raise requirements for new/amended IT processes, best practices, and standards
Member of the product leadership team
Takes direct ownership of the most significant technology and design issues
Acts as the focal point for significant infrastructure and development issues throughout
What you will bring
5- 9 years of multi-disciplinary security architecture experience in a large, complex organization
College or University degree in Computer Science and/or Software Engineering or equivalent experience
In-depth technical knowledge in Security Domain
Integration and complex solution design in multi-tiered spanning multiple organizations and hybrid IT environments
Strong understanding of industry best practices and experience with architectural frameworks
Ability to effectively communicate technical details to Engineers and Operators
Self-starter with the ability to comfortably operate in ambiguity
Excellent communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Strong interpersonal skills and a demonstrated ability to work effectively in a geographically dispersed team environment
Knowledge and experience in additional architecture domains (e.g. Network, IT Service Management, Compute, Storage, Desktop, and Collaboration)
What will set you apart
Experience in the financial services industry or in a similar complex and regulated industry
Experience with DevSecOps and Agile
Experience with modern hybrid security architecture patterns
Experience with securing modern data products residing in cloud (reporting platforms, analytics, and databases), model development concepts and data pipelines

Service Cloud Consultant

column2: Senior Solution Architect and Product Owner
column7:
Req Id: 379711

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.

If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

About the Role:

We are building a new 5G cloud core network with advanced slicing and edge computing capability to help create the next generation of consumer and business services. The technology is cutting-edge and the opportunity for you to make an impact is huge!
As Senior Solution Architect / Technology Product Owner within the Smart Core Architecture & Technology team, you will be expected to work in a highly cross-functional environment with standards-based strategists, architects, network engineers and product management personnel, in conjunction with vendors and external partners. You will also be expected to deliver strategic recommendations to executive stakeholders, and solidly transfer these into execution through your leadership, influence and process-centric mindset.
Your primarily focus will be to define the strategic plan, capabilities, and network topologies for emerging 5G core technologies. Accordingly, the successful proponent must possess a solid working understanding of multiple technology domains including RAN, core, transport, management and orchestration, as well as cloud computing. Aside from a strong technical acumen, the candidate must have proven leadership skills and possess the confidence to facilitate and drive collaboration across multiple technology domains, in order to formulate a clear E2E vision for the new technology introduction.

Job Duties/ Accountabilities:

Guide the E2E strategy, discovery approach and technical product MVP’s for the introduction of new 5G wireless technologies, examples including E2E network slicing, UPF on edge, 5G core evolution to hyperscaler cloud, and 5G core network function roadmap evolution.
Collaborate with other Network Strategy, Network Development & Product teams to research and establish emerging business use cases and associated benefits that will consume these new capabilities into roadmaps, as well as partner with technical SME’s to translate these into technical requirements for delivery
Work with vendor partners to understand and steer their software roadmaps in line with our business & technology vision
Deliver executive level presentations on plans and progress

Critical Skills/ Qualifications:

Educational background in Electrical Engineering, Applied Science, or Computer Science
Minimum 5 years’ experience working as an architect or technical product manager in the area of wireless core, with technical working knowledge of RAN, transport and automation/orchestration technologies
Strong technical acumen and ability to pick up new technology concepts quickly
Proven ability to work in an ambiguous, emerging technology environment, and be able to drive clarity and alignment of team members towards a common product development goal
Working experience acting as an architect or product owner within an agile delivery framework
Working experience applying experimental methodologies, such as lean thinking, design thinking
Working knowledge of agile collaboration tools – Confluence, Jira, Miro, Slack
Superior skills in facilitating, collaborating, and influencing peers and executives
Proven track record of creating and presenting compelling executive presentations
Always willing to “pick up the ball” and “get things done” without being told what to do

Individually we are people, but together we are Aviva. Individually these are just words, but together they are our Values – Care, Commitment, Community, and Confidence.
We are looking for an Infrastructure Architect to join our team to enable the business through projects and programs, to deliver outstanding services and experience for Aviva customers.
This is an exciting opportunity to join an experienced team of collaborative enterprise, infrastructure and solution architects. As we are now launching multiple transformation level initiatives, we are growing and strengthening the team to support all the programs in our portfolio.
We embrace a culture challenging the status quo and constantly look to efficiently simplify processes, technology, and workflow.
This position reports to the AVP, Security & Infrastructure Architecture.
What you’ll do
As an Infrastructure architect you will play a critical part in projects and initiatives across the organization. You will drive those engagements acting as a technical lead in designing, planning, consulting and working together to achieve exceptional solutions and supporting business objectives. Working with the different business units applying your expertise, you will help translate business demands, craft the technology landscape to enable business capabilities, transform technology advancement into business value, and make a profound impact on the growth of the organization.
Working collaboratively to gain alignment from other architects, project management teams, business teams, and IT teams on solutions requires a balanced mix of technical, business, and communication skills and is the key to the success of this role.
Does this sound like you?
Key responsibilities and accountabilities
Build and articulate solutions and design for projects to meet Aviva’s standards for technology and ensure they meet our ambitions efficiently for availability, security, resilience and performance
Produce design options with associated costs, benefits and risks to enable investment decisions
Engage with Product Owners, Enterprise Architects, Development and Infrastructure teams and other project colleagues to govern the competing perspectives between long-term and short-term goals
Represent solutions in technical reviews and discussions with client partners
Be responsible for the integrity of the end-to-end technical solution, including transition states used to achieve the target state
Shape and estimate IT initiatives and feature team sprints, ensuring that component parts deliver against business outcomes
Provide leadership on key designs to ensure long term strategic goals of Aviva IT are met, as well as short-term project needs
Ensure you produce artifacts to support the stakeholder group for service, security, architecture and engineering
Define the security controls for a variety of cloud and on-prem workloads, by closely working with our Information Security team
Peer review the artifacts of others - provide mentoring and training to less experienced team members as required
Contribute to the Infrastructure Architecture practice across Aviva Group, leading or participating in initiatives to improve Aviva’s approach to craft
Develop your own technical skills to support Aviva’s journey and our appetite to take advantage of emerging technologies and trends
Recommend design solutions or ideas in response to challenges faced by your project or feature team in relation to policy, process and other guidelines
What you’ll bring
University Degree in either Computer Science or Computer Engineering
Minimum 3-5 years of hands-on experience with design and implementation of architecture solutions.
Experience of solution architecture and architecture methodologies e.g. TOGAF
Financial acuity to support development of business cases and to inform on key design decisions
Experience with applications required to detail and deliver solution proposals and documentation (PowerPoint, Visio, etc.)
Solid understanding of end-to-end project lifecycle methodologies (mainly agile)
Agile (Scrum or Kanban) experience including use of Jira
Able to balance strategic direction and vital short-term goals
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Excellent partner and relationship management
Technology experience
Experience with server hardware and operating systems (Windows, Linux or Unix)
Experience with Virtualization technologies and infrastructure (VMWare, Hyper-V, etc)
Expertise with various clustering technologies and high-availability solutions at network, host and application level.
Experience with one or more Cloud Infrastructures (AWS, GCP, Microsoft Azure)
Understanding of up-to-date Network architecture concepts and system integration principles including routers / switches, Network & Security,
Experience with database engines (Oracle, MS SQL Server, Maria, MySQL, etc.)
Applied knowledge of middleware and integration technologies (IBM WAS/IHS, JBoss, Tomcat, DataPower, etc.)
Experience with key security design constructs, principles, platforms and services (Firewalls, IDS/IPS, security zoning, etc.)
Expertise in various storage technologies and platforms – SAN, NAS, Object, Archival and Data Protection.
Expertise with assessing and defining resiliency, high-availability and disaster recovery capabilities at application, system and/or infrastructure level.
Nice-to-have
Call Centre solutions experience
Working knowledge of application containerization technologies (i.e. Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)
What you’ll get:
Join a great company and culture, and a phenomenal team!
Competitive rewards package
Comprehensive benefits package, including Medical/Dental, personal wellness, defined contribution pension plan, share matching plan
Annual performance related bonus and pay review
Exceptional career development opportunities
Vacation allowance of 20 days plus statutory holidays, personal floater day, the option to buy/sell up to 5 additional vacation days and time off for volunteer opportunities
Discounts on many Aviva products through the Employee Purchase Program plus discounts for Friends and Family (some exclusions apply)
We will support your professional development
Additional information
Aviva Canada has an accommodation process in place to provide accommodations for employees with disabilities. If upon commencement of employment you require a specific accommodation because of a disability, please contact your Talent Acquisition Partner so that an appropriate accommodation can be arranged. This process applies throughout your career with Aviva Canada.

Company Summary:
Founded in 2004, NetBrain is the leader in network automation. Its ground-breaking platform provides IT teams with end-to-end visibility into their hybrid network and streamline NetOps workflows through automation. Today, over 2,500 of the world’s largest enterprises and managed services providers leverage NetBrain’s platform to automate network documentation, troubleshooting, and change management.

“NetBrain’s success is due to our people, and over the years, we have been fortunate to attract top talent because of our unique culture and exciting mission to transform the network management industry.” - Lingping Gao, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of NetBrain
Overview:
What We Need
The world of networking is rapidly evolving with multi-cloud, SDN and virtualization technology. NetBrain is positioned to solve the largest unsolved network challenges; problem diagnosis automation across hybrid network. We are looking to add a Principal Network Architect in the CEO’s office. This role will lead the transformation of network operations through automation, leveraging our state of art automation platform across the 2,500 enterprise customers. The individual will be reporting directly to the CEO and founder, while working closely with engineering team, R&D team and customers.

The Impact You’ll Make
Through this role, you will have a massive impact on the entire network industry by enabling automation as the default solution to all levels of network operation challenges, at scale. You will be leading a NetOps revolution in that no-code becomes the standard way to build automation. Additionally, you will be working with the world’s largest network and smartest network professionals every day. There will be no shortage of challenges and excitements when the largest IT challenges are gracefully solved by automation.
What You'll Do:
You will be the lead evangelist of automation value and our no-code automation approach in front of customers, industry peers and our internal engineering team
Lead the architecture, engineering and implementation efforts of NetBrain’s automation system for the world’s largest networks.
Train and enable internal and external engineering teams to become the next-level automation practitioners, with systematically designed courses and workshop.
Engage with existing partners in both hardware and software industry, to facilitate collaboration to better serve common customers.
Lead and manage the creation of NetBrain’s automation library, to accelerate the customer’s automation journey
Who You Are:
Bachelor’s degree in a technical subject (STEM)
Industry Network Certification such as CCIE, JNCIE is preferred
10+ years of Experience in one or more of the key areas, with a demonstrated history delivering positive results within: Network Operations (NOCs), Network Security, Network Planning, Design and Implementation, Continued Network Optimization
Experience with common network management tools including Network Monitoring, Incident Management, Log Analysis etc.
Professional Services experience highly desirable
Strong presentation and communication skills
Hands-on experience and mentality to apply automation to network operation challenges

Overview:

You’ve got big plans. We have opportunities to match, and we’re committed to empowering you to become a better you, no matter what you do.

When you join KPMG you’ll be one of over 227,000 professionals providing audit, tax, advisory and business enablement services across 146 countries.

With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, there’s no limit to the impact you can make. Let’s do this.

The opportunity:

KPMG’s Technology Consulting Practice strives to deliver business benefits from a broad range of technologies, helping our clients develop high-performing IT functions and leverage investments in current systems to deliver significant business value.

We help clients define their Information Management / IT / Digital strategy and assist them through the entire technology and digital transformational journey, for them to become a digitally connected enterprise. We help CIOs make their function future ready. Our skills in IT strategy and systems implementation help clients execute their transformation strategies with the technology best suited to their business, data and information requirements.

As part of our growing Canadian Salesforce practice, you will play a pivotal role in helping organizations transform how they engage with their customers. Our elite delivery team is focused on designing and implementing unique solutions for the market that leverage the full breadth of the Salesforce platform offering.

We are seeking a Salesforce Technical Lead with proven experience leading technical teams and developing innovative solutions powered by the Salesforce platform. This is a critical role on any project and requires a strong technical skillset and communication skills to lead a team and engage with client stakeholders.
What you will do:
As a Salesforce Technical Lead your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
Lead a team of technical resources (developers, technical BA, configuration consultants) to design and implement Salesforce solution design
Bring deep experience designing robust and complex Salesforce solutions, including data and security model design
Responsible for managing client technical stakeholders, communicating concepts and eliciting decisions, and sharing experience on technical best practices and approach
Working closely with functional leads and solution architects to design overall application architecture and ensure alignment with business goals and functional designs while adhering to platform best practices
Coach and mentor technical team members on coding standards, technical best practices, and ensure alignment in execution of project related activities
Provide guidance to and ensure alignment of team members in preparation for client meetings, presentations, demos, or other required project forums
Support and mentor team members on the creation of detailed design and documentation of each component of the solution such as data migration, integration, custom development, or other relevant areas
Performs regular reviews on the deliverables produced by project team members
Responding to pre-sales and technical questions to provide product and business expertise to assist team in preparing and presenting proposals, RFP responses, and tailored demonstrations.
Staying current on Salesforce platform capabilities/offerings and related technologies
What you bring to this role:
Advanced knowledge of the Salesforce/Force.com custom development (e.g. Apex, LWC, Triggers, Unit Testing) with ability to share best practices and coding standards
Strong experience (5+ years) designing and delivering technical aspects of Salesforce implementations and integrating Salesforce to external systems
Salesforce certification for Administrator and Platform Developer I or higher
Familiarity with devops processes and best practices using commonly used tools
Commitment to building a diverse and inclusive team
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrated analytical, problem-solving, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
Nice to Have:
Industry cloud implementation experience and/or certification (ex. Financial Services Cloud, Health Cloud, Public Sector Cloud, etc.)
Experience working with Salesforce AppExchange ISV partner products
Government Security Clearance
Travel Required: Less than 25%

Our Values, The KPMG Way:
Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters

KPMG in Canada is a proud equal opportunities employer and we are committed to creating a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free workplace that allows all of our people to reach their full potential. A diverse workforce is key to our success and we believe in bringing your whole self to work. We welcome all qualified candidates to apply and hope you will choose KPMG in Canada as your employer of choice. For more information about Inclusion, Diversity & Equity in Recruitment, please click here.

For general recruitment-related inquiries, please contact the HR Delivery Centre at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca.

If you have a question about accessible employment at KPMG, or to begin a confidential conversation about your individual accessibility or accommodation needs through the recruitment process, we encourage you to contact us at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or phone: 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778.

Who We’re Looking for
Speridian is a global business and technology solutions provider, we help clients modernize their businesses through Digital Transformation. At our core, we are an Information technology consulting and services company with a proven track record of solving business challenges with our unique, industry-based consultative approach. We achieve excellent results by partnering with talented people.
We are seeking a Salesforce Solution Architect to help build our Salesforce Practice, including our Salesforce consulting & delivery capabilities and working together with our Sales team to support their efforts for aggressive growth.
As a Solution Architect, you will own the integrity and strength of the solutions recommended. You’ll be acting as a trusted advisor to our team and clients, and an effective mentor for other Salesforce professionals working alongside you. You will need a deep understanding of the Salesforce platform but just as importantly, top-notch people skills to get your ideas and solutions across to stakeholders and gain integrity to get your visions built into successful solutions.
This is a varied delivery leadership role, with the following responsibilities:
· Conduct research into clients’ use of Salesforce, producing a report of findings with recommended steps and a roadmap for Salesforce solutions,
· Translates business requirements into well-architected solutions and provide detailed level of effort estimates for proposed solutions. Articulate the benefits and risks to a solution’s feasibility and functionality,
· Collaborate with colleagues and customers to create prototypes and proofs of concept as a means of eliciting and defining requirements,
· Groom and refine the Salesforce product backlog for clients, in liaison with stakeholders on the project,
· Own the design of Salesforce and (optionally) other affiliated solutions for Sales, Service, and CRM platform solutions,
· Act as a release manager, approving configuration and coded items to be deployed between environments. Where appropriate, this could include deploying changes,
· Provide guidance on user story writing style,
· Ensure success and acceptance criteria are defined for each story,
· Describe and illustrate designs with appropriate justifications,
· Design and oversee the execution of test plans to ensure a quality solution is delivered,
· Collaborative project and workstream planning,
· Provide hands-on, expert-level technical assistance to coach and mentor junior technical and functional team members
· Follow and understand new Salesforce product and technical capabilities resulting from product releases and acquisitions
· Provide expertise during sales efforts to estimate the technical level of effort
· Participate in marketing events (e.g. sales meetings)
Qualifications
At least 5+ years’ experience in a leading role in delivering Salesforce projects,
Excellent communication skills, written, verbal, and interactive when online,
Minimum Salesforce certified (of course, more is desirable):
Administrator
Sales Cloud Consultant
Service Cloud Consultant
Platform App Builder
Platform Developer I, II
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
A pro-active personality, with a can-do attitude,
Excellent relationship-building skills,
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to observe trends. Able to actively make suggestions based on the results,
Available and responsive to question, clarifications, and instructions
Ability to tailor communication to multiple audiences at all levels
A self-starter, experienced in leading projects or delivery work streams
Outstanding written communication skills
Ability to demonstrate concepts visually and in writing in a way that enables stakeholders to decide with confidence
A strategic approach to solution design, with proven ability to develop and execute tactical plans to support the strategy
Excellent ability to coach, motivate and direct work tasks to a multi-disciplinary team of Salesforce professionals
Nice To Haves
· Experience with Clariti
· Experience working in Public Sector
· Experience with DocuSign, ideally CLM
· Salesforce Public Sector Foundations experience
· Bachelor’s / Postgraduate degree or professional qualification in Business, Computer Science, Marketing, Finance or a similar field of study,
· Salesforce Designer certifications,
· Salesforce Architecture certifications,
· Active in the Salesforce community.

Position Description:
CGI's Product/IP team is quickly growing thanks to our success in the market, we are proud to be launching a brand-new product for Financial Planning/Financial Wellness.
Your future duties and responsibilities:
Define the target architecture and high level design for a CGI Global Wealth and Capital Markets product
Working with Product Engineering and Product Management teams to identify technical, functional and non-functional requirements (such as security, reliability, scalability) that the architecture and high level design must address
Validation of effort estimates from the Product Engineering teams
Writing technical portions of responses to customer RFPs and RFI
Definition of the required infrastructure (server, network, support software, etc.) to support the Product deployments for CGI’s Global Wealth and Capital Markets clients
Leading domain visioning exercises, creating, updating and proposing technical documentation material for client deliverables and presentations
Participating in and sometimes leading technology evaluation requests and recommending the solution aligns with enterprise strategy; ensure that the solution meets all non-functional requirements like Security, Scalability, Reliability, etc.
Assisting with establishing key architecture standards, tools, best practices, and methodologies to enable the client’s target state and enable its architecture evolution and alignment across the organization
Working with other architects to define, champion and govern technical architecture standards, tools (design and run time), best practices and development methodologies
Working with the Development team on the design and implementation of our products
Have an “EA perspective"" and collaborate regularly with other architects to ensure solutions align with enterprise direction
Identifying strategic and tactical solutions and an ability to influence and negotiate with clients, colleagues and business partners
Keeping abreast of technical innovations, new products and services of interest to financial services industry
Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
8 - 10 years progressively senior experience in Information Technology with solid background in IT strategy and technology planning
Experience in IT strategy & technology plan development
Experience in analyzing and translating business, information and technical requirements into an architectural blueprint that outlines solutions which integrate across applications, systems and platforms to achieve business objectives.

Skills
Ability to deal with clients, internal senior management, other architects, infrastructure specialists and development teams
Ability to create and present material both internally and to clients
Ability to work in a collaborative environment for Product Engineering, Product Management and client teams.
Strong Java Development expertise
Spring/Spring Boot experience
MongoDB experience
Microservices Architecture
Experience with a CI/CD pipeline
Experience working with public cloud providers
Docker & Kubernetes experience

As an Onix Solution Architect focused on Application Modernization, you will help customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Cloud Solutions. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of how technology is used in the workplace. Working alongside the sales team, you will consult with prospects and customers on their challenges, collaborate with experts to innovate solutions based on your own knowledge and existing Onix patterns, and finally provide a complete solution scope. You work closely with a cross-functional team of cloud and data specialists, not to mention a variety of both regional and international customers. Your relationships with customers will be critical in helping grow our business and bringing our portfolio into companies both big and small around the world.
A focus on Data means understanding the needs of customers with large and complicated data. You will architect solutions that will automate the processing and manipulation of the data and information into usable streams for the customer.
When working with customers and prospects, you are expected to be the first one to pick up a marker at the whiteboard and lead the room in deep-dive, discovery and understanding workshops. You must possess excellent technical, communication, and organizational skills. Any previous experience with cloud platforms and infrastructure products, content/document management systems, and relational databases will be on display as you engage with customers to understand their business and technical requirements.
Primary Responsibilities
Lead strategic cloud application development discovery session to help customers understand the value of cloud application development and how to position it within their organization.
Proactively help customers address all technical issues that may arise throughout the entire pre-sales cycle.
Create customer and partner connections to help grow Onix name recognition in the data space.
Establish strategic customer relationships and become their go-to trusted advisor for Big Data needs.
Ability to facilitate demonstrations, proof of concepts, and public-facing presentations.
Use Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services tools to build Enterprise-grade Big Data solutions.
Architect new cloud-based data pipelines.
Ability to bring together multiple data sources into a unified data warehouse.
Apply analytics and visualizations to customer data sets.
Assist in strategic direction and planning for the growth of the Cloud Data Team.
Quickly architect sound cloud solutions to radically different customer environments.
Establish strategic customer relationships and become the technical go-to resource for answers as well as a trusted cloud advisor.
In-depth understanding and the ability to demonstrate expertise in designing, deploying, and maintaining custom enterprise web applications.
In-depth understanding and the ability to demonstrate expertise in using a variety of development languages.
In-depth understanding and the ability to demonstrate expertise to determine the best migration path from legacy or on-prem applications into public cloud environments.
Review and analyze customer architecture at the domain and product level and translate and evolve them into cloud-ready applications.
Staying in constant communication with customers to ensure Onix is addressing all of their needs during the pre-sales cycle.
Learning and maintaining an in-depth understanding of current and new development technologies and industry standards.
Assist account manager with technical discovery and responsible for all technical scoping activities during the creation of the Statement of Work.
Ability to travel throughout the United States and Canada.
Required Skills and Experience
Degree in Computer Science or Math (or related technical major) or equivalent practical experience (math strongly preferred).
Experience with big data concepts (i.e. analysis, extraction, schema, lineage, etc.) for complex and large data sets.
Experience extracting data from multiple sources via APIs and scripting.
Experience with REST API development.
Experience with microservice applications and cloud-based services.
Experience with data lake concepts for landing, refining, and analyzing data.
Developing canonical data models (for example conformed dimensions) for enterprises.
Migrating large data sets from on-prem to cloud environments.
Experience with large data sets and Enterprise-grade databases (structured and unstructured).
Good understanding of the built-in data types. ( lists, dictionaries, tuples sets).
Experience architecting and building data pipelines.
Deep understanding of the ETL (extract, transform, load) process.
Developing data pipelines for large-scale ETL transformations.
Experience transforming data through field mapping, programmatic rulesets, and data integrity checking.
Able to expertly convey ideas and concepts to others.
Excellent communication skills (verbal, written, and presentation)
Creative problem-solving skills and the ability to design solutions not immediately apparent.
Ability to participate in multiple projects concurrently.
Customer-oriented and shows a bias for action.

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.
At Canadian Tire we work flexibility embracing ‘Hybrid’ whereby individuals utilize a combination of working at a CTC campus and or virtually in service of outcomes. Determined by managers, decisions around work location will be made based on business and team needs and grounded in a desire to support individual well-being and personal needs. Our Technology team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Aptum is focused on being the Managed Service Provider of choice for customers looking to transform their IT with hybrid multi-cloud environments. To that end, we have an exciting opportunity for an experienced, skilled, and market-focused Product Manager for our AWS Cloud services.
