Join a team of passionate thought leaders in a dynamic and collaborative environment! The Cognizant Microsoft Business Group (MBG)'s Intelligent Workplace team is growing fast and we're looking for our next Microsoft Identity and Security Architect to join us.
ROLE DESCRIPTION
What impact will you have in this role?
As a member of the delivery team, you will help lead our customers on their cloud transformation journey by taking advantage of Microsoft-based Security, Identity and Governance solutions based on a Zero Trust model.
What will you be doing day-to-day?
Deliver strategic Identity-based security consulting for a diverse customer base, including strategic design, planning and guidance, implementation, and training
Lead or participate in projects to help migrate customers' identity platforms during Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures
Lead projects support customers looking to improve their identity security posture for Office 365 and other applications using Azure AD as their identity provider (IdP)
Design and deploy related identity-based security solutions including, but not limited to: Azure AD, Conditional Access, MFA, Azure PIM, Azure Identity Protection, and Azure Password Protection.
Roll out security governance and auditing tools including, but not limited to Microsoft Cloud App Security, Microsoft Threat Management, and Defender ATP.
What experience do you need to be successful in this role?
2 or more years of relevant experience
Experience with some of the following Microsoft-based identity solutions:
Azure AD SSO
AD FS
Conditional Access
Privileged Identity Management
AD Connect
Microsoft based Identity Protection
Azure AD Password Protection
Azure Threat Protection
Experience with Microsoft 365 Advanced Threat Protection (Device Security, Messaging Security)
Experience with Microsoft Information Protection and DLP
Experience with Active Directory and migration tools such as ADMT or Quest Migration Manager
What education and certification credentials are needed for this role?
Bachelor's or Associates degree
Any of the certifications below are preferred:
Microsoft 365 Identity and Services (MS-100 and/or related experience)
Microsoft 365 Mobility and Security (MS-101 and/or related experience)
Microsoft 365 Security Administration (MS-500 and/or related experience)
Does the role require travel?
Travel up to 30% of the time might be required.
Security Responsibility:
All employees must act in accordance with The Cognizant Microsoft Business Group (MBG)'s corporate security standards.
ABOUT THE COGNIZANT MICROSOFT BUSINESS GROUP (MBG)
The Cognizant Microsoft Business Group (MBG) has a singular purpose—advancing your cloud modernization journey with focus, simplicity and scale. The Microsoft Business Group is an end-to-end Microsoft-centric cloud solutions and managed services provider that leverages extensive experience and IP to deliver constant innovation and business value, powered by the Microsoft Cloud platform. We are designed to reflect how you think about cloud transformation from a platform native perspective. Our dedicated experts and trusted blueprint deliver your digital difference through the Microsoft Cloud: Azure, Microsoft 365 and Dynamics 365. We turn digital potential into real business performance at speed.
Who We Are
We are the destination employer for Microsoft-committed professionals, providing depth of specialization and differentiated career paths. We have authentic conversations, build connections and grow careers while centering ourselves around our employees. We are a global team of certified consultants across all relevant technologies, coupled with cloud focused advisory consultants. With our supercharged talent, we are the world's best Microsoft partner. We prioritize investing and expanding.
EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
As a Global Cloud Transformation Consultancy business, the Cognizant Microsoft Business Group (MBG) understands diversity and inclusion in the workplace brings benefits to our customers, our business and most importantly, our people. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and we provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment.
The Cognizant Microsoft Business Group (MBG) prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other factors protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including all aspects of the recruiting and employment life-cycle at Cognizant Microsoft Business Group (MBG).

Job Description

There When It Matters for 175 Years

This year, we are proud to celebrate our 175th anniversary. Since our founding in Quebec in 1846, we've been committed to improving the financial health of all of our clients. We are driven by the opportunity to help families thrive, communities grow and businesses succeed. As our roots have grown stronger than ever before, we are ready to lead the way for the next 175 years.

Laurentian Bank Financial Group (LBCFG) is a diversified financial services provider whose mission is to help its customers improve their financial health. The Laurentian Bank of Canada and its entities are collectively referred to as Laurentian Bank Financial Group (the "Group" or the "Bank").

With more than 2,900 employees guided by the values of proximity, simplicity and honesty, the Group provides a broad range of advice-based solutions and services to its personal, business and institutional customers. With pan-Canadian activities and a presence in the U.S., the Group is an important player in numerous market segments.

This role sits within LBC Tech, a subsidiary of Laurentian Bank Financial Group.

The solution architect is an advisor and subject matter expert representing technology helping to solve complex problems to support business goals. This is a key role shaping the strategy and implementation of technology projects across the Bank. You will also provide expert consultation to project, business and development teams on new initiatives. You will develop application roadmaps to help modernize the Bank's application ecosystem. You will be responsible for creating end to end solutions, working very closely with the business stakeholders and development teams. You will help guide and lead the technical teams throughout the development cycle.
Responsibilities

º Works with the business and technical teams to define scalable, available, and resilient end to end solutions spanning digital front ends and back end systems taking into account the enterprise architecture strategy
º Has in depth understanding of technology solutions, including cloud, containerizations, and APIs
º Creates and maintains the technology application modernization roadmap to evolve platforms to meet business objectives
º Demonstrates analytical mindset with strong affinity for problem solving in complex environments
º Influences the Bank's strategic orientation by implementing technological solutions that optimize the quality of services and operations
º Ensures solutions being proposed are viable and balance strategic and tactical goals, and meet project budget and timelines
º Performs impact analysis to understand which upstream and downstream systems are impacted
º Contributes to the growth of the architecture practice by helping define the enterprise architecture objectives, standards, creates and maintains supporting documentations and artifacts
º Provides subject matter expertise, helps lead the technical teams and is a trusted advisor to the business
º Works with Security, Data, and Infrastructure architecture to ensure all facets of architecture are being considered
º Demonstrates excellent communication and negotiation skills required to clearly articulate and explain the proposed solution to senior stakeholders
º Helps define the SDLC to ensure development and testing automation processes are in place to optimize efficiency and quality
Qualifications

º 7+ years of architecture experience implementing solutions for large programs with excellent understanding of how to build resilient systems, that are secure and interconnected in a complex ecosystem
º Experience in designing secure solutions using security best practices
º Prior experience in software engineering
º Experience with designing and implementing cloud-based architecture solutions, front end, REST APIs, Service Oriented approaches, Mobile and Digital technologies, and infrastructure
º Experience in Agile software development projects
º Strong leadership skills
º Knowledge of the banking and financial sectors
º Experience with Enterprise Architecture framework such as TOGAF
º Strong team player with demonstrated ability to work in a fast paced environment
º Experience in design and development of high availability platforms
º Experience with enterprise architecture modeling tools such as Sparx EA, BIZZdesign, MEGA, Archimate is an asset
Additional Information

Equity, Diversity & Inclusion:
We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible work environment that reflects the diversity of our customers and our communities. We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, including Indigenous people, women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities, regardless of race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics, disability or any other legally-protected ground.

About us:
Peoples Group is a boutique Financial Institution with offices located in Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto and Montreal that has been in the Canadian marketplace for over 30 years. Our mission is to exceed our customers' expectations by providing exceptional customer service backed by extensive product knowledge and experience.
Our culture here at Peoples Group is formed by our values; Strength-Based, Relationship Focused and Passionate Execution. We believe people don't choose a company to work for, they choose a company to join. We also believe that people come first and each day we strive to be willing, trustworthy and creative.
About you:
You are a technical leader with experience architecting, optimizing, and governing Microsoft hybrid cloud solutions in large enterprise. You are a strategic thinker who enjoys formulating strategies and nurturing technical capabilities to reach long-term objectives. You have in depth hands-on experience developing and operating a broad range of Microsoft Azure solutions.

10+ years of technical experience in areas such as system administration, software development, DevOps
5+ years of Azure Cloud Architecture experience, including design and build of enterprise scale hybrid / IaaS / PaaS solutions, as well as tenant structuring, security, connectivity, and cost optimization
Delivery experience with SDLC – both project and Agile/Scrum development methodologies
Azure Solutions Architect Expert certification
Strong knowledge of M365, Dynamics 365 CRM and Power Platform
Ability to think strategically and relate architectural decisions / recommendations to business needs and long-term enterprise roadmap
Ability to learn and understand new toolsets and products quickly
Solution-focused, takes initiative to work effectively within established guidelines
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Knowledge of and experience in the Financial Services industry is a plus
About the day-to-day:
Develop technology roadmaps and architecture standards to guide and optimize Microsoft / Azure technologies deployment in the enterprise
Plan, lead, design, and govern cloud solution implementation for major initiatives including assurance of third-party deliverables
Create, maintain, and organize architecture documents and artefacts to capture current state architecture and share knowledge
Participate in Architecture Review Board to peer review architecture design and advise on new initiatives
Coach and mentor peers on solution design, best practices, technological approaches, etc.
Explore new innovations, conduct technology proof-of-concept, and drive adoption of new and emerging cloud capabilities
Interfaces with industry on current trends in business and information technology
Provide ad-hoc support to cloud operation team during critical incidents to help meet defined IT service levels and business / customer expectations

Come work with a team that values diverse ideas, fosters a culture of inclusion and develops our talent from within. Loblaw Technology gives you the chance to excel, and helps you to strive for success in a big way. Keep reading to learn more!

Senior Site Reliability Engineer, Toronto, ON
As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer, you will be responsible for the architecture, maintenance, and development of tools to ensure reliability of our applications. Working as part of the Loblaw Technology SRE Team, you will collaborate with multiple engineering teams across various verticals. Your primary goal will be to aid adoption of cloud native solutions, develop tools and capabilities which helps us to build better and more resilient systems.
What You’ll Do:
Design, architect, and develop cloud native solutions using services like Kubernetes, AppEngine, Cloud Functions, CloudSql, Pub/Sub on Google Cloud Platform and Azure
Be a subject matter expert in at least one area of business or tooling, and be responsible for diving deep into code, presenting new ideas to leadership, and sharing knowledge with the team and broader organization
Identify and diagnose deficiencies related to existing frameworks, tools and processes, and recommend creative solutions to reduce waste and continuously improve
Build and own infrastructure through code, maintain our high-quality code base by performing code reviews, and work closely with development teams to automate CI/CD pipelines to remove repetitive processes and simplify operational needs
Mentor new team members and help shape the SRE discipline across the enterprise

What you Bring:
Hands-on experience with software engineering, computer science, computer engineering or related technical field (experience programming in Java, Python, or GO is asset)
Passionate for troubleshooting technical problems and automating solutions to reduce manual toil
Inspired by working with both a Development and SRE mindset (i.e. software and infrastructure)
Comfortable with Cloud Native platforms (knowledge of Google Cloud Platform is an asset)
An enthusiastic sense of ownership and a desire to build things from scratch
What Loblaw Offers You
We offer flexibility and balance, and an environment that sets you up for success no matter where your workspace is located.
Here, you will find a great team to help you achieve your goals as you help us achieve ours! Work in our fast-paced, exciting Technology environment, helping our stores, colleagues and customers every day.

column2: SharePoint and M365 Technical Delivery Lead
column7:
Overview
Do you consider yourself top of your field as a SharePoint and M365 Technical Delivery Lead, working with clients to understand their needs and designing and building solutions largely using Microsoft technologies? Then read on…
Whitecap (www.whitecapcanada.com) designs, develops, integrates, and supports Custom and industry-leading Packaged software solutions based largely on Microsoft technologies. We are a dynamic firm, developing leading edge business applications for Canadian clients on all platforms. Our projects vary in scope and length, with technical challenges and professional growth opportunities aplenty. We offer a relaxed work environment with flexible hours, competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a wonderful environment in which to build a fulfilling career in all aspects of technology. Whitecap also has a significant Microsoft M365/D365/Power Platform team with lots of opportunity to grow your skills.
The opportunity:
Whitecap Canada strives to deliver business benefits from a broad range of technologies, helping our clients develop high-performing IT functions and leverage investments in current systems to deliver significant business value.
We help clients define their Information Management / IT / Digital strategy and assist them through the entire technology and digital transformational journey, in order for them to become a digitally connected enterprise. We help CIOs make their function future ready. Our skills in IT strategy and systems implementation help clients execute their transformation strategies with the technology best suited to their business, data, and information requirements.
We are seeking an experienced SharePoint Solutions Architect with excellent technical knowledge of SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive and related Microsoft cloud solutions to join Whitecap Canada’s Microsoft practice. You'll work directly and collaboratively with technical, management, and client teams to deliver high quality development services and welcome opportunities to research and implement new technologies
What you will do
The SharePoint M365 Technical Delivery Lead will be comfortable in all aspects of Project delivery including solution design, development, technical specs, prototyping, requirements definition, technical support, integration support, and more. Your responsibilities will include:
Overall application architecture and design decisions during a project to meet client requirements and systems, ensuring solutions align with business goals and processes, and fit within the enterprise context.
Assists the functional resources/business analysts with requirements gathering and provides design guidance for SharePoint M365 and Power Platform projects. Lead workshops with customers, documents requirements and designs appropriate solutions.
Provides leadership and technical guidance to the project team throughout the implementation to ensure successful delivery of Project.
Work as a development lead and be able to demonstrate a wide range of development skills. Be a strong advocate for adherence to standards and best practice. Understand the capabilities of the development team and schedule their work appropriately, providing support and assistance when needed.
Facilitates discussions with business and technical stakeholders to extract critical business requirements and present a technical vision and solutions in the form of software products, customizations, and integrations to meet those needs within SharePoint M365
Respond to Pre-Sales and technical questions and provide product, technical, and business expertise and assist team to prepare and present tailored software demonstrations.
Provides best practices and solution alternatives as part of functional or technical design documents.
Ability to be client-facing including effectively communicating with the client, leading meetings, and capturing and distributing action items.
Occasionally assist with providing inputs to the project plans, estimates and scope for sales proposals and statements of work.
Stay current on SharePoint M365 for Customer Engagement and related technologies, particularly Power Platform and Azure cloud technologies that support the solution
What you bring to the role:
5+ years of hands-on experience of building solutions using Microsoft SharePoint, and related MS technologies.
Proven experience as either a technical lead, technical architect, or solution architect with SharePoint
Experience working with the SharePoint to build custom workflows and applications
Extensive experience with the .NET Framework, ASP.NET, C# development and various JavaScript frameworks.
Familiarity with PowerApps, Flow, Logic Apps, Microsoft/Office Graph, and SharePoint Modern Pages/Web Parts preferred
Leading Migration Projects Plan with experience and expertise in leading a SharePoint Migration.
Proven ability to create innovative solutions to solve complex business requirements, and streamline/automate business processes
Demonstrated analytical, problem-solving, organizational, interpersonal, communication skills
Experience with leading or participating in the gathering and documenting of business processes and requirements for the system with key business users
Nice to Have:
Professional certification in SharePoint, Power Platform & Azure certifications.
Experience with integration services such as SSIS/ShareGate, Microsoft Flow, and Azure Integration Services
Experience with Power BI or other reporting-based technology
Experience with responsive design and front-end frameworks such as Bootstrap
Experience with ASP.NET Core and ASP.NET both MVC, WebForms and API based development
Scrum methodology awareness and previous work in an agile environment
Any suitable combination of education, training, or experience is acceptable
We are looking for Someone with:
Outstanding communication skills (oral & written), with the ability to interact confidently with all levels of management
Demonstrated project or engagement management ability to plan and execute projects/engagements to a successful conclusion
Proven track record with the types of business development activities and an established network of relevant contacts
o Ability to solve problems efficiently, think creatively and deliver quality user focused software solutions in a timely manner.
o Ability to work in the central GTA (401/DVP area) with onsite/remote flexibility
o Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident legally entitled to work in Canada without sponsorship
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $85,000.00-$125,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Casual dress
Company events
Dental care
Extended health care
Flexible schedule
Flextime
On-site parking
Paid time off
Profit sharing
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Supplemental pay types:
Bonus pay

SharePoint: 5 years (required)

Our client…

is the leading law firm specialized in providing advice and services related to the management of digital information. Using advanced machine learning technology and retaining a highly specialized multi-disciplinary team.

What's in it for you?

Outstanding benefits from day one, including insurance premiums paid by the Firm and wellness and technology reimbursements.
Competitive compensation, paid overtime, and generous time off, including a day off to volunteer and a day off for your birthday.
A commitment to professional development and growth opportunities for our people at all levels, supported by a culture that fully embraces and encourages two-way feedback.
Strong community involvement and a commitment to equity, diversity, and inclusion.
A collaborative, cohesive culture that connects lawyers and business teams through collective purpose.
Responsibilities:

Supporting the Director, Applications in the planning of application technology roadmaps and leading practices.
Supporting the Director, Applications in the planning and coordination of the application portfolio life cycle, with a focus on application development, system and data integration which includes application program planning, application design, application build, testing, and deployment/commissioning. Application portfolio includes SaaS, PaaS, cloud hosted business solutions, applications, and end user computing software (e.g., desktop/laptop/mobile device).
Together with the applications team, developing, facilitating, and maintaining application development standards, procedures and roadmaps.
Supporting the Director, Applications to ensure application functions are designed / configured to meet business requirements and IT standards (including IT security); tested in accordance with the testing methodology; performed in accordance to operating requirements; and deployed to meet service/operating/commissioning requirements. This includes the coordination of work with other stakeholders in IT, business practice groups, and vendors.
Providing advice and recommendations to the Director, Applications on emerging application technologies and opportunities to improve performance / capacity / scalability and to mitigate risk of application services.
Designing systems, applications, and user interfaces to meet business requirements, which includes:
Working with internal and external Business Analysts to understand the business needs and interpret the requirements into a solution design for presentation to appropriate stakeholders.
Performing system and network analysis, researching software and hardware products or services, when needed, and identifying the most appropriate/best value solutions that can be implemented within resource constraints.
Designing and developing systems to meet technical specifications.
Providing expert advice and engaging in the resolution of complex application and system issues, in collaboration with other stakeholders in IT, business practice groups, and vendors.
Ensuring documentation is developed, maintained and knowledge is transferred among other IT stakeholders.
Providing technical advice and support to the Application Analyst in the development and implementation of application solutions.
Providing advanced custom development expertise and advanced technical support for deployed solutions and processes.
Providing advice to and participating in work teams with other stakeholders in IT, Project Management Office (PMO) and other business practice groups from an application development and systems integration perspective.
Must Have:

University degree or equivalent in Information Technology.
Minimum of ten years of information technology experience, three years of which in a senior application development/architecture or systems integration role.
Possess broad range of technical/application knowledge (business, middleware, end user computing software, SaaS, PaaS, networking, security, etc) and application development life cycle experience in multiple technological platforms.
Experience and ability in exercising a lead role in the conceptualization, design, and implementation of application technology initiatives.
Possess practical ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library) experience, certification an asset.
PMP certification an asset.
Demonstrate business acumen and experience in managing business relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Experience with a professional service organization's structure and processes is an asset.
Ability to exercise strategic thinking and problem-solving skills in managing complex situations.
Ability to advocate strategic initiatives and exert constructive influence with stakeholders.
Ability to handle multiple concurrent pieces of work, and appropriately applying judgment about the prioritization of effort.
Capacity to handle high pressure situations and tight deadlines.
Strong organizational, work and time-management skills.
Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills.

Our client…

AI and Machine learning company in the Food operations space

What's in it for you?

Be part of a strong development team that delivers Enterprise SaaS solutions. Apply your skills to help our customers drive business value from our retail operations solutions.

Responsibilities:

Support collaboration between development and other departments. Work with internal and external team to identify and understand business requirements and translate them to functional and technical specifications and provide technical solutions ranging from design through to code level.
Lead in the architecture, design, specification, development and implementation of cloud-native SaaS software solutions and legacy on-premise applications


Must Have:

o Microservices and Cloud (Azure)

o C++ and JavaScript (ReactJS)

o Experience in large SQL systems

Nice to Have:

o SME

o OOP/OOD

The Opportunity
Delaware North is seeking to add a Data Architect to the Enterprise Architecture team. The Data Architect will support data service to implement and drive industry best practices for data ingestion, modeling, structure, and storage with optimal data processing throughput results. You will operate in collaboration with developers, architects, data experts, and key stakeholders, ultimately driving key insights for the business.
This is a growing team that enables Delaware North's vision of using data as a differentiator. Our work is the foundation of company initiatives to automate business processes, gather insights, and make informed decisions. The team uses PaaS solutions and Open Source software to aggregate, process, catalog, and distribute large data sets to the company, our clients, and partners. Users of the platform range from NASA to several MLB, NBA, NHL, and NFL teams.

We are open to a remote candidate, though occasional travel to our Global Headquarters in Buffalo, New York will be required.

At Delaware North, we care about our associates. We are committed to invest in our people's personal and professional journeys, without you, there is no us. These are just some of the benefits we offer: health, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) with company match, performance bonuses, paid vacation days and holidays, and generous friends-and-family discounts at many of our hotels and resorts. Click here to learn more.
Responsibilities
Thought leader with 6+ years of experience in Data Architecture, Data Engineering, and Governance
Experience in leading data architecture initiatives and developing transformation architecture for project/product initiatives.
Solid understanding of the cloud provider's options for data pipelines, data management, data streaming, and data analytics (e.g. AWS solutions and platforms )
Solid understanding of architecture concepts like Data Lakes, Data Mesh, and Data Lakehouse
Strong implementation experience in implementing Enterprise Data Foundation Solutions and Master Data Management Capabilities
Familiarity with API, microservice, and integration concepts and technologies, such as REST, SOAP, JSON, XML, message queues, and integration patterns/frameworks
Ability to influence architectural decisions to solve business problems/needs.
Troubleshoot data issues across multiple data sources in a distributed environment
Interface with clients, vendors, and internal users of the data platform on understanding the data
Work closely with the business to identify and specify opportunities for integration with existing systems in a highly resilient manner
Works with the data engineering team to identify platform enhancements for increased supportability and reliability
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent from an accredited college or university in Information Management, Computer Science, Computer Systems Engineering, Business Administration, Mathematics, or a related field.
10 or more years of experience within information technology with 2 years of experience as a solutions architect, or equivalent position responsible for documenting system designs and ensuring alignment to best practices.
Experience with modeling and design frameworks, including supporting viewpoints to communicate system components and their interactions.
Experience in translating complex technical concepts into easy-to-understand designs for any audience.
Experience with technical concepts such as integration platforms, cloud services, networking and computing concepts, application frameworks, and data modeling approaches.
Ability to travel as needed.
Who We Are
At Delaware North, you’ll love where you work, who you work with, and how your day unfolds. Whether it’s in sporting venues, casinos, airports, national parks, iconic hotels, or premier restaurants, there’s no telling where your career can ultimately take you. We empower you to do great work in a company with 100 years of success, stability and growth. If you have drive and enjoy the thrill of making things happen - share our vision and grow with us.
Delaware North Companies, Incorporated and its subsidiaries consider applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status. Summary: In this role, the Cloud Data Architect works as a consultant for Onix clients to define their architecture for how to ingest, store, process, analyze and explore/visualize data on cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, GCP, Azure). The cloud data architect provides the thought-leadership for the client and then translates that to actionable steps for cloud data engineers to implement. This role is both architect and analyst but specific to cloud data technology.
Primary Responsibilities:
Deliver data architecture projects for Onix clients.
Deliver high-level architecture design documents for customer engagements.
Develop detailed-level design requirements for data architecture implementations.
Work with clients to understand and develop their target data architecture needs.
Assess an organization’s readiness for using data on a cloud platform.
Work internally to develop delivery guides, assessments, and common data architecture patterns for cloud data projects.
Work with cloud architects, cloud data engineers, and developers on engagements to deliver end-to-end solutions for clients.
Preferred Skills and Experience:
AWS Data Analytics, Machine Learning, Database Specialty certifications a plus
GCP Data Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer certifications a plus
10 years experience working with big data architectures
Experience working with AWS, GCP
Customer-facing soft skills such as communication, conversation, and business awareness.
Three to five years’ experience in a Cloud Data Architect role or related position
Five to seven years’ experience implementing foundational data architectures
Experience with data processing software (such as Hadoop, Spark, Pig, Hive) and with data processing algorithms (MapReduce, Spark)
Experience in writing software in one or more languages such as Java, C++, Python, Go, and/or R
Experience working data warehouses, including data warehouse technical architectures, infrastructure components, ETL/ELT, and reporting/analytic tools and environments
Experience architecting, developing software, or internet scale production-grade Big Data solutions in virtualized environments such as Amazon Web Services, Azure, and Google Cloud
Experience working with big data, information retrieval, data mining or machine learning as well as experience in building multi-tier high availability applications with modern web technologies (such as NoSQL, MongoDB, SparkML, Tensorflow)

Job Description
Enterprise Solution Architect
P2-6
Scarborough, Ontario (Hybrid)
Toyota Canada Inc. (TCI) is the exclusive Canadian distributor of Toyota and Lexus vehicles. Toyota Canada's head office is in Toronto, with regional offices in Vancouver, Calgary, Montreal and Halifax. Toyota parts and accessories are distributed through TCI's Parts Distribution Centres in Bowmanville and Vancouver. TCI supports over 287 Toyota and Lexus dealers in Canada with services that include training, sales, marketing, environmental and customer satisfaction initiatives.
What Sets Us Apart?
A focus on People, Passion for Toyota, Innovation and Make Things Better has made us an award-winning company, recognized worldwide for our technological leadership and superior standards of quality, community involvement and environmental responsibility.
Job Summary:
Toyota Canada Inc. (TCI) has an exciting opportunity for an Enterprise Solution Architect. This position will report to the Manager, Enterprise Solution Architecture. The selected candidate is responsible to provide end-to-end architecture oversight and technical leadership to mid-to-large size complex projects. This role is cross-functional and enterprise-wide.
What We’ll Bring:
A hybrid work environment
A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility and respect
Competitive compensation package including health and dental benefits, and bonus
Health and dental benefits effective immediately
Company pension plan with matched contribution
Associate vehicle discount program
Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement
Fitness reimbursement
Great company culture – Respect for people and continuous improvement is at our core
Paid holiday shutdown and competitive paid time off benefits
Summer Hours – condensed work week during the summer
Sabbatical Leave Program
What You’ll Be Doing:
Provide end-to-end architecture oversight and technical leadership to mid-to-large scale projects
Lead project level architecture efforts by driving technical discussions, whiteboarding sessions and building consensus amongst solution architects for the target state solution
Collaborate with solution architects (domain specialists) and lead a matrix structure team during the solution design and delivery process
Collaborate with Solution Architects, technical resources, other Enterprise Solution Architects and IS Management
Collaborate with Information Security to ensure solution meets security requirements
Ensure alignment to broader enterprise architecture standards, strategies and roadmap and maximum reuse of existing technology assets to minimize technology costs and footprint
Actively pursue avenues to simplify project solution architectures as well as the Toyota architecture ecosystem
Lead vendor solution assessment efforts, POT, POC exercises, as required
Create and maintain conceptual current state architecture diagrams
Develop conceptual target state architecture diagrams, ARB materials (solution options and recommendations, vendor evaluation and recommendations, solution blueprint documents)
Review and sign off detailed (physical) architecture documentation ensuring alignment to solution blueprint and broader enterprise architecture standards, strategies, and roadmap
Provide guidance and oversight of 3rd party support vendors to ensure technology solutions meet TCI standards
Work with vendors and internal teams in creation of RFI/RFQ/RFP/SOW/A3/A4 documents
Establish and maintain strong relationship with IS teams at other Toyota affiliates to identify opportunities to leverage common technology
Review security access methods and compliance to TCI and TCCI audit requirements.
Other projects as assigned
Nice to have – integration architecture background/expertise, expertise in developing integration architecture standards (APIs, microservices, messages and batch jobs)
Nice to have – expertise in developing integration architecture roadmaps and strategy
What You’ll Bring:
University Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Business or relevant experience in Information Management
Wholesale, retail, automotive or manufacturing industry experience would be an asset
Minimum of 5 years of large-scale solution design and delivery leadership experience as an Enterprise Solution Architect or Lead Architect (either matrix or direct reporting structure)
Minimum of 2 enterprise scale multi-million dollar technical solutions under the belt as Enterprise Solution Architect/Lead Architect
5+ years of progressive experience as a solution architect (any discipline) with another 10 years of experience in IS/IT as a technical specialist
Excellent understanding of various technologies and enterprise tools (ERP, CRM, WHS, HCM)
Experience designing HA solutions/environments
Significant exposure and experience leveraging enterprise scale middleware technologies (Mulesoft, ESB/IIB, Tibco, JBoss, IBM WAS, MQ etc.)
Experience with cloud platforms, SaaS/PaaS/IaaS
Proven strategic thinker with the ability to assess the current state against the target state and provide the big picture, future vision for a project
Ability to converse with business (all levels from staff to executives)
Ability to start conceptual level solutioning with high level business requirements and refine solution as additional requirements are added
Strong interpersonal and leadership skills including influencing, collaborating, facilitating, and negotiating skills to drive consensus on technical solutions
Must be able to present to technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to lead and manage multiple projects and proof of concepts
Ability to explain complex technical issues in a way that varying IT/IS and Business Teams may understand.
Outstanding communication, organization, time management, and interpersonal skills
General knowledge of hardware, software, application, and systems engineering
Excellent analytical skills, problem solving skill and creative thinking. Solid experience with technical gap analysis, impact analysis and cost-benefit-analysis, basic project planning and end-to-end estimation of technical workstreams
Team Player with a ‘can do’ attitude
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance
Highly self-motivated and driven to execute projects
Effective skill exercising initiative and using good judgment to make sound decisions
What You Should Know:
Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business. Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, or any other characteristics protected by law.

Department Overview
Building a World-Class Technology Team at TD
Information Security Architecture is part TD’s Architecture Practice, with alignment to TD's Enterprise Protect OCISO (Office of the Chief Information Security Officer) group. TD's Architecture Practice is responsible for cross line of business consultation, solutioning, strategy and planning for enterprise capabilities. In Information Security Architecture, our vision is to enable the business by continuously reducing information security risk by ensuring the presence and completeness of security qualities in derived works (solutions) based on Information Security Architecture artifacts (Security related Patterns, Target State, Road maps, Principles, Position Papers, etc.)
Job Description
About This Role
Security Architecture will be responsible for securing TD across the enterprise, driving the qualities of security throughout the environment and data lifecycle.

As an Information Security Architect, you are required to be a self-directed, motivated security professional and have responsibility over assessing the alignment of the assigned projects and initiatives with Enterprise Protect security standards, published Target State Architecture and security patterns. In addition;

The successful candidate must work strategically and transparently within Security Architecture supporting Security Domains.
Perform project and program assessments and provide constructive feedback through SAR (Security Architecture Review) process and solutioning
Contribute in the creation and maintenance of Target State Security Architectures, Security Roadmap, Security Architecture Principles that ensure the qualities of security are maintained in derived solutions for assigned Security Domains
Contribute to security system design and architecture frameworks including technology architecture strategy, policies, ‘guiding principles’ and governing standards for security the assigned domain.
Apply industry/technical knowledge to provide solutions that increase business results and minimize risk
Representing Security Platform in development and implementation of the overall global enterprise cloud architecture
Design and develop security architectures for the target public cloud

Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:

5+ years of experience in an enterprise, solution or Security Architecture role or a related field
Applied knowledge of business requirements and architecture to the maintenance and enhancement of the enterprise-wide and/or project specific architecture frameworks and models
Translate security standards and patterns into programs and projects requirements on architecture level
Work with other Architects, Design Leads and stakeholders in peer review to ensure the continued presence, appropriateness and completeness of security qualities in solutions
Participate in the development of requirements to facilitate both business vision realization and security architecture target state creation
Understand the capabilities and limitations of the security components (e.g., technology, operations, and management)
Influences product direction and integrates technology from a security and architectural perspective within the business environment
Identify enhancements and gaps in architectural frameworks, standards and patterns to raise them for consideration for inclusion in the future versions
Participate in knowledge transfer with senior management, the team, other technical areas and business units
Work effectively as a team, supporting other members of the team in achieving business objectives and providing client services, lessons learned and knowledge transfer

Additional Information
Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:
Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, share your knowledge and educate others.
Communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical professionals.
Cultivate winning relationships by building trust with business and technology partners.
Share our commitment to productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiency.
Embrace change and witness amazing things happen – from the inside.

The Professional Services organization is passionate about delivering Salesforce's premier product and project offerings to ensure customers are getting the most out of the Salesforce Platform. We help customers accelerate their path to value with Salesforce, focused on making sure you’re set up for long-term success to tap into the full capacity of the Salesforce platform, fast. We help you plan your strategic roadmap, and we make sure you are building Salesforce so that it’s easy to maintain and adapt down the road, minimizing potential technical debt.

Our organization is made up of thousands of the world’s leading Salesforce experts. We share our own 20 years of product standard methodologies with your team and partners so that you have everything you need to achieve your goals.

Technical Architect Director Role
As a Technical Architect Director you will be serving as a strategic advisor and Salesforce product and platform expert to the company’s largest, most complex enterprise customers.
Here are some salient responsibilities the role entails -
Lead teams made up of technical architects and developers and work with executive leadership
Facilitate consensus of proposed solutions from top management levels
Work with cross-functional teams
Lead virtual teams
Project Management
Provide thought leadership
Formulate and deliver action plans for high profile critical initiatives

Identify and lead internal critical initiatives to grow the consulting practice; serving as an active contributor to the community’s overall knowledge base and expertise
Guide customers and colleagues in rationalizing and deploying new technologies that drive increased business value
Work collaboratively and having very strong communication skills, especially in teaching complex concepts, and creative, prescriptive thinking
Identify and proactively manage risk areas and commit to seeing an issue through to complete resolution
Manage customer expectations; negotiate solutions to complex problems with both the customer and third-party partners
Review and correct project/program direction, approach, and key artifacts to keep programs on track and solutions extendable and maintainable going forward
Work closely with Delivery Managers, Solution Architects, and directly with clients to architect technology solutions to meet client needs
Contribute to a program vision while advising and articulating program/project strategies on enabling technologies including the Salesforce Platform
Workshop facilitation
Minimum Requirements:
10+ years’ enterprise architecture or consulting experience
Strong application design skills combined with strong data, integration, and security architecture skills
Multi-Cloud implementation experience
2-5 years leading and managing people
Strong experience presenting to clients or other decision makers to present and sell ideas to various audiences (technical and non-technical)
Strong client management skills
Travel may be required and varies depending on the client requirements

Good team mate: Proficient at collaboration and working with members of a team
COMMUNICATOR: Speaks and writes with clarity, brevity, and purpose; explains the area of expertise clearly and confidently to others; influences and engages C-Level with authority and confidence

Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Senior Solutions Architect, Mobile Banking
Job Description
WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?
RBC is a digitally-enabled relationship bank. We strive to engage our customers when, how and where it’s most convenient and to provide a highly-personalized experience. We also collaborate broadly with innovative business and technology partners to create a platform and ecosystem that can bring even more value to our customers. We care deeply about the success of our customers and communities.
We’re looking for an experienced solutions architect who is passionate about our mission to join the Digital Architecture team, with a focus on Mobile Banking. We want vocal futurists that can advocate their vision, who will be excited about creative problem-solving as part of a cross-functional team; will obsess over providing simple state of the art solutions; will tirelessly strive for the best end-user experience and will have the drive and desire to keep learning the latest architecture developments and standards / techniques.
WHAT WILL YOU DO?
Define end-to-end technical solution architectures for Mobile Banking initiatives
You will join a team of similarly talented and driven architects and contribute to both ongoing improvements to our platform and customer experience and to new platform initiatives.
Partner closely with development and delivery teams and with business partners in a fast-moving, product-based development environment.
Be an integral part of the delivery team but play a vital role in linking design and architecture to enterprise standards and industry best practices.
Create end-to-end technical solution architectures using modern UI, micro-services and cloud technologies, and informed by hands-on prototyping.
Develop roadmaps to provide guidance for both product managers and engineering teams on the usage of new technologies and how to achieve our longer-term platform goals.
WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?
MUST HAVE:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related technical field (e.g. engineering, physics or mathematics), or equivalent practical experience.
5+ years of security architecture experience
Solid experience with a variety of modern technologies/approaches including event-based architecture, cloud-based deployments, REST/API first applications, mobile and web technologies
Demonstrated ability in written and oral communication skills along with strong presentation skills. Ability to determine the information and communication needs of the stakeholders and project.
Strong organizational, project management and time management capabilities.
A strong understanding of technology and/or financial services industry.
Deadline-driven and results-oriented; able to meet consistently high quality standards while handling a variety of tasks and deadlines simultaneously.
NICE-TO-HAVE:
Multi-channel application design experience
Experience in agile ways of working
Ability to facilitate between and influence key decision makers
Strategic thinker with excellent interpersonal skills to work across functions and businesses
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
A world-class training program in financial services
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work
